Reviews.Title: “Saved our trip!”
Reviews.Author: aimee0722
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at a hotel down the road the first two days of our trip. We called the comfort inn at hotel circle after hearing they had updated their rooms. We moved over that afternoon. From the get go it was a million times better. Great breakfast, great rooms (although larger scaled vanity would be nice), pool was perfect and so was location. The service was amazing! Housecleaning accidently scooped up my daughters blankie when changing the bedding, the next day they delivered it washed just before we checked out! Nightmare road trip home avoided!

Reviews.Title: “Good value city hotel with free shuttle to nearby attractions”
Reviews.Author: AnaMPP
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a weekend getaway. The price was right and the location suited me. It is not in the liveliest areas of San Diego if you are looking for night life, but it is just 1 mile from Old Town, where most train and buses run by, and it offers complimentary shuttle ride within 5 miles. Thus Sea World, San Diego Zoo, and Old Town,are all a free ride away. The shuttle can pick you up too if pre-arranged. And the drivers go the extra mile to give you directions and make you feel welcomed. This is a clean and hospitable 3 stars hotel on the Hotel Circle, about 6 miles from downtown. Breakfast is included in the price (basic breakfast). It has a pool, a helpful staff that will gladly offer information on tours and book them for you. The room we stayed in was spacious, and the bed was comfortable. No great views or anything extraordinary, but it serves the purpose if you are in the city to explore it and make the most of your days out.

Reviews.Title: “Kid friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorina L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok the people is San Diego were very nice and helpful including the customers! We ended up staying 2 nights, My husband and I took our nephew and our 2 boys to the San Diego Zoo and our kids just looved being at the hotel rather than the Zoo because they went swimming the WHOLE TIME, my kids enjoyed every minute of the pool because it wasn't very deep for them it only went up to 6ft, my nephew actually learned how to swim here!! the pool area was very clean and the water was clear, they even had towels put out for us! the only problem was there were no bathroom around the pool so I had to take my kids all the way up to the room soak and wet to use the restroom. The breakfast was ok, we had better at different hotels that also served complementary breakfast but it was free so i can't complain. The other problem I also had was the fitness center was VERY small so if you plan on coming to have a good work out during vacation don't bother bringing your gym clothes your better off doing laps in the pool! We had the kids suite with the bunk bed and king bed, there were 2 tv's with 1 remote control, the other thing I had a problem with were the see through curtains between the kids room and the king room, i wanted to walk out of the shower to get dressed because the bathrooms were already small as it is but couldn't because i had my nephew, it would have been easier to have thick curtains so i asked the house keeper for 2 extra blankets and covered the doors. Other than the small negatives, i'd deff recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good value in good location”
Reviews.Author: Karakron
Reviews.Content: We asked for a king bedded room, and to confirm this request they gave us one of those family rooms which I wouldn't recommend when you don't need those kids beds, as the "parents" bedroom is like a middle room without any window and therefore really dark and looking unfriendly. We changed the room and got a 2 queen bedded room which was pretty much the same size as this family room =much more space! It seems that there has been a recent renovation, everything looks new and contemporary stylish. The breakfast is a mess, too loud and food everywhere on the floor, I nearly slipped on something, so I'd rather go somewhere else. The reception was very friendly. What I really didn't understand is that they charge for the parking (approx 8,- $ per night), they should include this in the price or make it for free. As we liked the location and the decoration, we would probably book this again when going to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel C
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was great, several amenities. Only thing I did not like was when checking out there was a employee who reeked like alcohol! Otherwise the breakfast was great and beds were comfortable. Hire someone who cares for their hygiene and health.

Reviews.Title: “No Negatives”
Reviews.Author: Rodney W
Reviews.Content: The only thing we could say negative would be that breakfast was a little crowded. It can be avoided if you get up earlier. However - lots of variety and good food to choose from - thus the crowds. Excellent place to stay when going to Zoo or SeaWorld. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: stapelady
Reviews.Content: First off the Staff (front desk and housekeeping) was excellent. Very friendly, very helpful and always had a smile. At first they had elevator issues but they resolved that issue quickly. The pool and hot tub area was beautiful and always in use. Plenty of parking..with security and if you get there early enough you can get covered parking. They have a laundry room next to the pool which is clean so if you need to do laundry you can watch the kids at the pool and watch your clothes. The Breakfast is excellent! Waffles (blueberry one morning, Strawberry the next and regular) danish, muffins, bagels, eggs, sausage. Coffee, tea, cappacino machine (vanilla and mocha) and hot chocolate. Juice, milk, cereal,yogurt and fruit EVERYthing! Really good help when your traveling. They gave us a list of directions to places to eat, malls, (target, walmart) and attractions, it was a great help! Rooms were clean, nice. The only issue is .. you either stay on the freeway side or the pools side. We had the pool side which is closed at 10pm so you don't have the noise all night. I was very impressed with this place. Internet needs work though.. and they need to have the printer, print many people wanted to print coupons and flight tickets and were unable to.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: Two queen beds and a fold out couch. Worked well for a family of 5. Clean bathrooms, good breakfast. Beds not bad. Good location, close to zoo, seaworld and downtown. Internet absolutely sucked. I don't know why hotels don't get that internet is important in this day and age. Try to book rooms on the north side of building. South side is right on the freeway, so you hear traffic noise 24 hours. Took over 20 minutes to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great. Clean and reasonably quiet. Front desk seemed to be helpful as they secured discount tickets to Seaworld for us plus a shuttle to and from the park. Except, the shuttle never showed up to pick us up. Front desk acted like they'd never heard of us or the shuttle. Did reimburse for the taxi ride however. Elevator was under construction while we were there creating a small distraction in the lobby. Otherwise, would recommend it for families traveling to Seaworld, the Zoo, or the San Diego area. A little difficult to find even with GPS. There are 3 Comfort Inns within 5 miles of each other so be prepared to go lobby to lobby until you locate yours.

Reviews.Title: “I found bed bugs in the room”
Reviews.Author: Bettylopez
Reviews.Content: I felt something crawling in my face ..and it fell to the pillow. I realized it was a bedbug, so my husband checked under the mattress and it was infested with bedbugs. We got so freaked out that we left as fast as possible. The hotel manger gave us another room in another hotel. She said that it was an isolated case, but I have heard that hotels can be infested.

Reviews.Title: “The Zoo”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: Exactly what they should call the breakfast area. Hotel is situated right next to the freeway. Really close. The Internet is slow. The parking is full. Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Close to Sea World & the San Diego Zoo”
Reviews.Author: JNargang
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting San Diego. The location was convenient to everything; Sea World, Zoo, downtown and the coast. They had a complimentary shuttle to sites within 5 miles. Very nice added benefit. We stayed in a King suite with bunk beds so there was plenty of room for us and our 3 small kids. The set-up was very nice although the bathroom sink could have been bigger. The breakfast (included in our pkg) was very good. It ran from 6:30-9:30 am and they kept restocking food items until 9:30. There was plenty to choose from: eggs (scrambled & hard-boiled), sausage, oatmeal, cereal, yogurt, pastries, muffins, toast and a waffle bar. Juice, coffee & milk. This was prob one of the best hotel breakfasts we've ever had, especially since we didn't feel rushed to grab food & finish before 9:30. Workers were extremely nice. The 3 downs, though minor, we're the TV in the king room was fuzzy, the bathroom fan made an awful racket and the air circulation was difficult to balance between the 2 spaces. I did tell the man when I checked out that the bathroom fan was noisy. He just nodded like he'd heard it before and didn't care. It sounded like metal grating metal and there was no way to have the light on without the fan. It was do loud that there were a few times I was in the bathroom with the light off just to have some peace. There was air units in both rooms but it was difficult to balance it w/o freezing one or the other room. The TV in the kids room was very crisp and clear while the other was quite fuzzy. Given the choice, I would definitely stay there again. It was easy to get to and really nice compared to some others we saw.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: sfelix254
Reviews.Content: I just had to share my experience with this hotel. First when I booked the hotel I called and spoke with a girl named Elena. I have never meet any body so eager to help and my family. I can honestly say she had the best customer service from any other hotels that I stayed at. Then to top it off when I got to the hotel she happened to be the one to check us in and she continued to give the best service ever. I would recommend if any one stays at this hotel to ask for by name (Elena). It was a plus that this hotel was close to everything and I enjoyed the breakfast. I would have to say we had a GREAT VACATION!!

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel but pretty nice for money”
Reviews.Author: Lovebeingadad
Reviews.Content: Not the best location but really a pretty good wide variety breakfast with nice beds and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious and central to all major spots.”
Reviews.Author: fun-sun-done
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great sized room, amazing concierge staff. Would definitely stay again. Hot breakfast buffet was included. Sausage patties and eggs were kinda pale looking but the cinnamon make your own waffles were AMAZING. Cappuccino machine and juice machine, danishes, toast, bagels, cereal. About 15min taxi from everything (between 15-20$ each way) which was ok but it wasn't really close to anything either which got kinda expensive.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location, perfect rooms”
Reviews.Author: Driver8rws
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple years ago and it has DEFINITELY been remodeled since then ! Just recently stayed on Feb 20-22, 2012. The "Traveler Photos" posted above are a very accurate representation of the new rooms. VERY CLEAN. VERY good service... We booked a King room, checked in and went to the room to find the sleeper sofa couch turned up on it's end and all the linens stripped off of it laying on the floor. But the rest of the room was clean (?) Called front desk and was promptly given another room (after lugging all of our crap back down to the lobby). Went to this room and it was a room with double beds!! Called down again and the desk receptionist met us up in the hall this time and upgraded us to a "Kid Suite" (2 separate rooms, one with King and one with bunk beds, 2 tvs, etc.) and comped our parking !! THAT is "customer service" !!! Great location for jumping on and off I-8 VERY quickly as opposed to some of the other hotels on "hotel circle". Will TOTALLY stay there again next time I am in SD !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awesome shuttle service!”
Reviews.Author: msneel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and went to SeaWorld and Old Town. While the hotel is not within walking distance of anything, they have a shuttle that will take you anywhere within 5 miles. The free breakfast in the morning is AMAZING! I will for sure choose this hotel again when we do come back to Diego. Awesome trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: coharahawk
Reviews.Content: Won this on a same day Priceline bid, and got a pretty good deal. We arrived late (about 10 PM) and found a couple police cars at the hotel next door. The area did not seem inherently unsafe, but was a little isolated. The parking was $8. The staff was not very helpful at that time of night (didn't tell us where to park, didn't tell us there was a parking pass that needed to be put in the front window, etc). The hotel is oddly shaped and we had to walk quite a distance from the car to the opposite end of the hotel. The room was large including a large bathroom and mini-fridge. My only complaint of the room was the very dark bathroom and sink area. Otherwise the room as above average to very nice. The complimentary breakfast was upstairs in it's own special area. There were waffles, eggs, sausage, fruit, bagels, etc. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: kgstevens
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a family suite. Our bed was pretty comfortable, but the bunkbeds were not. The cleaning staff were average...while things were decently clean, we weren't always left with enough towels/washclothes. Also, our last morning, the maids knocked earlier than we expected, so if you want to sleep past 8 am, put out the do not disturb sign. One of the reasons we chose this hotel, is the free breakfast buffet. We only ate there the first morning. It was disappointing both in food quality and adequate quantity of tables and staff. While we won't stay there again, it is still an average accomodation. We prefer a few more amenities, so for us, it was just O.K.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: motraveler03
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently and my husband was in need of a "doc in the box" for a minor helath issue. The front desk person not only found one for me but then printed off the directions. He was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mcquigge
Reviews.Content: Quick check in, very hospitable staff, extremely clean, great start breakfast (full), location is great, kid suites are great for space and privacy. Would stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: spamthis17
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! From check in until check out, everything was perfect! Christian and David at the front desk were wonderful help with everything from extra towels to helping us find a place to park an oversized vehicle. Our in room fridge wouldn't cool down and it was replaced within 10 minutes of placing the call. The rooms are clean, except for under the vanity where we found old guests' receipts and stuff. Beds were great. Rooms are spacious. Breakfast was one of the best free breakfasts I've had and is so convenient to have it in house when traveling with children. We called for room service from the steak house next door. Excellent food and very decent prices with no outlandish room service charge! Another plus after a long day with kids. I'd definitely recommend this place to families traveling to San Diego. It is right off the 8 freeway and is close to major attractions. We did not notice road noise, but we were on the north end of the building. Stay here; you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family. Good value and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Littondoddy
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommended. We stayed in a "kids room" for around $119 a night including breakfast and this was very competitive. The kids rooms have two single bunk beds in a separate room, partitioned from the parent's area by a sliding glass door. The kids had to walk through the parent's area and there is not a lot of privacy, but it is ideal for a family of four. When we were there, the main demographic of guests were senior citizens and families, which suited us. It was hard for us to discern San Diego accommodation online, for two adults and two children, where the children require separate beds ( ie many do not allow rollaway beds and we preferred that the kids didn't have to share a queen). This hotel had a clear offering for this configuration, at a good price, in a good location, which was our reason for choosing the hotel. We found it clean and comfortable. The hotel advises that you should plan your breakfast timing and this is good advice - the breakfast room is small and crowded if you go on the peak times. There is a heated pool that we didn't use, a good guest laundry and a small business centre, and WIFI access. The location is about a 15 minute drive from Seaworld. There is a parking fee of $8.50 per night. Our only complaint is that the room cleaning had neglected under the vanity, which normally would not be a problem, but we dropped something that rolled under there and had to navigate months of dust and previous guest grunge. Eewww! We notified reception. There is no safe in the rooms and unauthorized people do access the hotel to tout resturants, etc, so you should plan your security. We used a complementary safe deposit box at reception, which was excellent. Reception re very helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean for short stay; spotty free wi-fi, but reasonably priced for SD”
Reviews.Author: bikinghiking123
Reviews.Content: Free wi-fi is very spotty from the top floor/4th-floor area. No hot water in the beginning (20 minutes running the shower). Maintenance man came and ran the water for a long time and mentioned that it takes longer for the hot water to run up the pipes up to the fourth floor. Issue resolved promptly and appreciated that. Breakfast is mostly cold. Hot fare consists of instant oatmeal, some eggs sausage, and make your own waffles. Sufficient for a free amenity. Breakfast room will be crowded, esp. on weekends. Rooms appear remodeled and refurbished. We booked a king room, but were upgraded to a suite due to overbooking of king rooms. Very spacious and only some hallway noise, but never heard adjacent rooms until we exited the room and could hear our neighbors. A surprise. Pillows are very square/small, but beds were clean and comfortable. Parking fee of $8.95. While there is free street parking, as others noted, it gets crowded, as there's another motel across the street. This secured covered parking fee is inexpensive for an urban city in CA. Average parking rates in LA, San Francisco, and even San Diego would easily be $15-30 per day. John at check-in was pleasant and nice. Recommend for families, but also for solo or couples of all ages traveling with a car when it's off-peak season. I'd imagine during summer, the hotel might be even more crowded.

Reviews.Title: “san diego panda visit”
Reviews.Author: vw1966
Reviews.Content: great place to spend a nite close to oldtown ,seaworld and the zoo and while you are at the zoo balboa park is is also great they have a great train ride and fantastic merry go round the hotel very clean and the service was great and so was the free hot breakfest didnot get to phills bbq it was closed for remod i have to try it out the next time! bbq is favoriate food!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: This is not a horrible "must avoid" motel -- and I might have given them a "3 star" average rating. But look at the attached photo of the sofabed that was in my room: I don't think I've ever seen a piece of furniture in sorrier shape in a major US motel chain. The sofa covering was literally peeling away, and obviously had been for some time. Otherwise, the hotel is slightly below average for a Comfort Inn. My "6 person" room was small, with the two regular beds and softabed wedged into a tiny space. There was some hair in the shower tub when I turned on the water. The breakfast spread was slightly larger than most Comfort Inns, but somehow the quality was lower. Eggs and sausage patties were cold, and the bread products were tasteless. OJ was undrinkably syrupy. Somehow, even the make-your-own waffles were rubbery and worse than normal. So I guess you can say I left with a bad taste in my mouth. :) On a positive note, the pool area looked above average for a Comfort Inn, and the front desk staff was pleasant. A GPS is helpful in finding this hotel as there are two Comfort Inns on Hotel Circle, less than a half mile from each other. So the GPS led me to the right one. Obviously, Hotel Circle is in a busy, highway-surrounded area, but it's convenient to most destinations in San Diego and I did not find the noise to be objectionable. As others have noted, there's a crazy parking charge (about $9) at the hotel. Unless you're driving a Ferrari or something similar, it is very easily avoided by using the ample on street parking in front of the hotel. It looked as safe as street parking anywhere, and many guests had chosen this option.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John Y
Reviews.Content: I needed a room to spend the night in on short notice and David at the front desk helped me get a comfortable bed with a nice hot breakfast. David was helpful as can be, he even set up a taxi service for me. If you are on the go and need a quick stop, the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Connie P
Reviews.Content: My daughter and family booked a room her for the bunk beds. They are in the military and stayed for a few weeks. Her husband was here for medical attention. They needed a car. David Garcia was so helpful in making that happen with no effort on their part. The car was delivered to the hotel. He was helpful with so many other unexpected needs. Thanks, David! I note that others complained about the accomodations, but things were being renovated while we stayed there. Good breakfast as included with room cost. It's not a five star hotel, but great for it's rating.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Rasika_Raghavan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. The hotel was convenient in getting to Sea World and the Zoo. Check in and check out was easy. Breakfast was really good, with a decent spread. Rooms were quiet, clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a bit outdated, and dark, especially while in the shower. The basin was outside the bathroom, as soon as you open the door, which was a bit odd. I also don't understand why they had to charge for parking as the hotel was not in a downtown area. But it was a comfortable stay and would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetSetterMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel only for 1 night as we were only transiting through this city. However, we were very impressed with the efficient check in, friendly staff and great location. We visited San Diego Sea World which was only a 10minute drive, one of the best shopping complex called Fashion Valley Mall which was only a 5minute drive and of course, San Diego Airport only 10 minutes. This hotel catered well for my family of 6 and although our stay wasn't very long, we would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “the Best place and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mal C
Reviews.Content: It was the best check in and easiest check out.It was the site of a great steak house.The room was beautiful and big,pleasant and comfortable.We had everything we needed and it was with in a comfortable drive for where we needed to go.The staff was out standing and had great recommendations for places to eat.When we came back from from being out we were always greeted with a smile and hello to us. We were asked how we were doing and chatted with us before we went to our rooms and if we needed anything.The breakfast was outstanding and tasty.There were two people that stood out at the front desk.One of them was Dwayne and the other was Elena.Elena checked us in and even called us to make sure everything was ok.Dwayne was very friendly,pleasant,always had a great smile.We will go back to Comfort Inn & Suites Zoo/Seaworld area. Don't change anything,great the way it is. It meant a lot to us because we were there because of a death in the family and came from NH.Thanks so much

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: crzyblonde23
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Christian checked us in and he was VERY friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great and was kept fully stocked. Only complaint is that the front desk guy at night, Dwayne, acted like he didnt want to be bothered with anything. Otherwise, GREAT stay. Definitely would stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay while going to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: jcrrorison
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on the web and after some research booked a suite as we were travelling from Palm Springs to spend a day or two at SeaWorld. The hotel is located near the end of Hotel Circle and was easy to find using our Garmin. Check in was smooth and efficient, taking less than 5 minutes...if that... We stayed in suite #354 and were pleased with the setup.....although the overall size of the room isn't that big, the connected bunkbeds were a big hit with our 3 1/2 year old daughter who insisted on sleeping on the top bunk as it was her first bunkbed experience. The side rails made us confident she wouldn't fall out, although after a day at Seaworld she didn't move much during her sleep. The hotel is situated in a location that made it easy to travel to SeaWorld and downtown where we had another great dinner at Bucca's......... The included breakfast was one of the best we have enjoyed in our travels, although continental in style it included fresh eggs, sausages as well as the usual goodies.......it saved us $20 bucks that we could use towards something else the girls likely needed........... Will return next year when we use our passes to come back to SeaWorld

Reviews.Title: “Best Guest Services Supervisor”
Reviews.Author: Ann S
Reviews.Content: We were booked into another hotel by mistake and arrived a Hotel Circle Place without reservations John Adkins provided us with great accommodations. The entire front end staff was friendly, humorous and efficient. The hotel was great. My only suggestion: change up the "hot" portion of the breakfast buffet. We stayed for 6 nights and enjoyed every minute of San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Superior value in this category”
Reviews.Author: traveldan21
Reviews.Content: We were going to be down in San Diego overnight and just needed a place to sleep, nothing fancy. Snagged this hotel via Hotwire and was pleased with the experience. Basic motel/hotel but clean with a nice, small pool for young families, and a pretty decent free breakfast with scrambled eggs, sausage, hard boiled eggs, cereal, instant oatmeal, waffles, pastries, bagels, yogurt, juice, coffee and mocha/hot chocolate. (The small breakfast area does get crowded, however.) We were traveling with our teenaged daughter so we requested two beds. When we checked in, they gave us room 343, a room at the end of the hall that had a longish corridor before opening out to two double beds, a sleeper sofa and a desk. The room could sleep 6 so there was plenty of room for the three of us. No view to speak of and it was a bit noisy from the freeway so if you're a light sleeper, probably should ask for a room facing away from the freeway. There is both covered and outdoor parking. They normally charge about $8 for parking but they waived the fee for us since there was a tiny glitch checking in. This particular room had plenty of closet/armoire/dresser space, a toilet/bath/shower room with a door and a sink area that was outside of that. An unusual set up that worked o.k. for this room because of the long corridor until you get to the bedroom area. This is not really a suite, just an unusually shaped room. The furnishings were updated but basic, except for the 32" flatscreen TV. A fridge and coffeemaker also were included, but no microwave in this room. Since we were there only overnight, we didn't use the fitness center, pool or laundry room but the fact that this hotel had all of those amenities seem to make it a good deal for the money. One tip: there are two Comfort Inns on Hotel Circle (sort of a loop filled with many chain hotels on either side of the 8 Freeway). This one is on the far west side of Hotel Circle, north of the 8. There is another one that is more east, on the south side: I think that one is called Comfort Inn Hotel Circle, as opposed to this one which is called Comfort Inn Zoo/Sea World. Make sure you check the address, etc. or you will find yourself getting back in the car and driving a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Comfort Inn EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Samir J
Reviews.Content: This is the best comfort Inn , I ever stayed in USA. Seriously Guys do not waste money on the any other hotel in SD. This one is close to downtown. Yummy Hot Breakfast, Free WIFI, Coffee Maker, Refrigerator Great amenities...friendly staff..What else you need?

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn & Suites Zoo / SeaWorld Area”
Reviews.Author: Tonya2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a family room. living area with leather sofa sleeper, tv and desk. bedroom area with two beds, tv, wardrobe, microwave and fridge. Upgraded furnishings and carpet. Plenty of parking ($7.50 per day), pool, jacuzzi, fitness center, free breakfast (waffles, pastries, eggs sausage, fruit, etc...)

Reviews.Title: “Bad Day At Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Jeannine G
Reviews.Content: I had come to this hotel frazzled and upset from a bad expireance with the best Western south bay hotel. Elena checked me in and apon seeing my condition or state of mind she got me into a beatuiful room at a very reasonsble rate and also waved the parking fee. the next day Bobby was very helpful in getting me tickets to the zoo and getting me a refund on non refundable tickets when i bought one too many, forgetting that with my son being military that he gets in free. the next time i travel to Sandeigo I am staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: eduk8r26
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days at Comfort Inn and Suites Zoo/Sea World. We had a kids' suite with a king bed and bunk beds and 2 tv's. Our room faced the pool and had no noise. The room itself was next to the elevator so I heard no tv noise from other rooms. It was quiet all the way around. The only noise I heard was in the morning when I was up anyway. It was nice to have a separate heating and cooling unit that was remote-controlled. The breakfast room was quite large, compared to some I have been in. There was quite a variety of food, including cappacino. The front desk crew were always friendly and greeted you when you walked through the lobby. My only criticism might be the tv needs a greater variety of channels. Too many sports and news channels! Otherwise, I would definitely stay again. As an aside, if you are looking for a good place to eat, try Phil's BBQ on Sports Arena Blvd. Great food!!

Reviews.Title: “Good family choice”
Reviews.Author: kle
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice; July 2011 and December 2009. The hotels is conveniently located with good family amenities, such as free breakfasts and a pool. Both times we stayed in the family rooms, which is a normal size room split in two with sliding doors. On one side is the kids' room with bunk beds and a TV. On the other is a queen bed and another TV. Worked out well for us and our young children. Clean if not special. Would stay there again. PS. Beware that there are two Comfort Inns on Hotel Circle and this is the nicer one.

Reviews.Title: “GO SOME WHERE ELSE!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: megan h
Reviews.Content: Comfort Suites charges $7 a night for parking, which isn't a problem, except for the fact that they charged me 4x what I owed!!!!! When I asked the front desk they denied ever charging my card. I then preceded to show them my bank statement as proof, and they just shrugged it off. I was never refunded my deposit either. The hotel is not worth this, GO SOME WHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but...”
Reviews.Author: TravelinHotelCritic
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and the rooms are clean. Although, The carpet had red stains all over and was in need of replacing. The ice machine in the hall leaked everywhere! On our fourth morning there was no hot water and I got to take an Ice cold shower. Way to many people for the breakfast room there was never a place to sit so we had to eat in our room every morning after fighting people to get food items. Called for a rollaway bed it took 9 hours for it to arrive after several more phone calls. It's an ok hotel for the money and it is relatively clean but it needs repairs and updating badly. Additionally it is really noisy with all the kids so unless you are traveling with a load of your own I would probably avoid this hotel as it was really hard to sleep sometimes!

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: dawn r
Reviews.Content: staff were excellent, rooms were very clean, waffles yum. pool refreshing I will stay here next time and send my friends. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Tammy A
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at this hotel! It was SO comfortable and nice. The staff was SUPER friendly, welcoming and helpful! Thank you so much for such a great time. We plan on staying here next year when we return!! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good but”
Reviews.Author: AmyLeeSydney
Reviews.Content: The staff in the hotel were friendly, the room was a good size and clean. Bed was comfortable. However, this hotel is not in a location where it is easy to walk around because it is on the side of a freeway. Despite there being no grocery store or 7/11 in walking distance, the hotel had minimal food available outside of one or two vending machines. That's not such a big deal I guess but we were annoyed at the hotel staff for organising local limo drivers who had set prices for their services. Three times we requested at taxi and three times hotel staff organized limo drivers who they seemed to know very well. These drivers did not have vehicles with meters and therefore just named their price. The drivers were not cheap by any means however they were punctual. On the whole though, we were dissatisfied with this element of our stay because we felt like we paid more for drivers than we would have paid for a taxi. For example, a ride to the local shopping mall which was literally 3 1/2 minutes away cost $10 and the driver waited for a tip. Someone should check on him cause he's probably still standing there waiting! Hotel was ok, breakfast was really good, location was better for people with a car but hooking us up with over priced local car services was unappreciated to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrsmponds
Reviews.Content: We stayed from earlier this week Sunday to Wednesday in a second floor room facing the pool. We never heard the freeway, and rarely heard anyone in the pool (and there were swimmers). We did have the ac on low or high but no noise came over it. Never heard next door neighbors, but did hear the folks above us at 4:11am moving around, throwing shoes etc. When I called the hotel to verify something prior to check-in, I asked if there was a microwave we could use in the breakfast room since we weren't reserving a room that had one (all rooms have small fridges but not all have micros) but the breakfast room I think gets locked up. The front desk attendant indicated if we brought the food to the front desk, they would warm it for us in the breakroom. Wonderfully, they did that for us twice at dinner time heating up burgers and beans. Check-in was very quick and easy. Christian did a great job. We were originally in a 4th floor room (out of 4 flrs) but preferred a room away from the freeway. Christian moved us to the 2nd floor room facing the pool. There isn't a level of guest rooms underneath where we were but the underground parking which never disturbed us. We got a double queen with a sofabed and had lots of room. The bathroom had one light and was a little dim but you get used to it. The sink is outside the toilet/tub room and is well lit. The fridge area is opposite the sink and has a storage shelf for your food above the fridge, and extra space on top by the coffee maker and ice bucket. We had a flat screen tv. The room is clean on the most used surfaces, but a couple need some attention (there is room between the walls and sides of the sink cabinet where stuff had fallen on the floor in between and was dirty; the sides of the bedside table had some spills dried on it near the floor.) The bed was comfortable; pillows a bit small but there are plenty given. There was some light mustiness in the halls and the room upon entering (the ac fixed that). There was no smoke smell in our room or on the floor (some nonsmoking hotels we've still smelled smoke in). The pool and hottub were really nice. Very clean. Towels were provided. Laundry room available (costs $4.75 I think per load for everything). Didn't use. Elevators though a little small, were both quick. Hotel provides luggage carrier racks to transport luggage to rooms from cars. Breakfast was great-lots of breads-bagels, danish, breads. There were scrambled eggs and sausage (I didn't try but my husband didn't care for them), yogurt, make your own waffles, cereals, coffees, teas, and juices. There were a few other things I think. Go earlier if you don't want a crowd. Tip-there are no trays to take food back to the room so we brought the small plastic tray under the ice bucket. While I was waiting for our dinner to heat, watched the front desk guy (I want to say Dwayne, but not sure that was his name) serving the guests. Always professional and helpful. I ran into him by the elevators while he was going up and he asked how our stay was and was very nice. The only issue we really had was our fridge would not get cool enough. We checked in around 515 and by 10 it still was at 53 degrees (gauge on top). The maintenance guy who came by said at 7 (when I called for service on it) that it should be at 41-43 degrees and should be at that by 8. Said he would come by then, but he didn't show. He thought that it wasn't cooling because we had so much stuff in there. Yes, we had filled it about 80%. We went to the pool at 915, came back at 10 and it was still above 50 degrees and not coming down, so I called back to the front desk. The maintenance guy showed up at the door toting another fridge. This one plugged in at 45 degrees and in an hour was down to 42. There is a Whole Foods within 5 minutes of the hotel, the Amtrak on Kettler was less than 10 minutes away and there was almost nobody on the road when I picked up my husband at 8pm. Seaworld and the zoo are very close. Very easy drives. We will definitely stay again. The service from all staff encountered was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: sandhugger
Reviews.Content: I searched for a hotel that offered a good and safe location (traveling single), free internet, free parking and free breakfast. This is not any easy task, believe me. I found this hotel which offered all the options I wanted. The location was perfectly located, central to San Diego attractions (I did rent a car). I was attending a 3-day conference at the convention center only a 10 minute drive. The staff were great and always available into the night. They even offered to print my boarding pass. This is a great family hotel, so there were lots of families with children, but noise did not bother me. The breakfast was adequate with both hot and cold selections. The internet worked great and parking plentiful. Also, next door is the Hungry Hunter restaurant. I look forward to staying here again for a vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “First time in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived Sunday morning around 11am and we were greeted by a one of the best customer service reps I've ever encountered in a hotel. His name was David and he was so helpful and was willing to share some favorite local spots (you HAVE to try Phils BBQ, look it up!). He let us know it was too early to check in but we were tired and he made sure we got a room as soon as possible. All in all he was very nice, told us where to eat, what beaches were easy to get to and had good shopping which made our first stay in San Diego an overall great experience. My only complaint would be the breakfast room being a tad bit too small. Other than that it was a wonderful hotel that made our first time here comfortable and relaxing. We'll be back soon thanks to the amazing staff, beautiful weather and David's wonderful hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Sandy8636
Reviews.Content: I read reviews of every hotel near Sea World/Mission Beach before booking our stay. There were so many scary reviews it was hard find a good place. My crucial criteria were clean, close and quiet - I'm really not that demanding. I have 2 kids, 3 and 13 months so having clean carpet and no scary critters were very important. This hotel was super clean. As for quiet, it was pretty good. We were on the pool side (as opposed to the freeway side) on the 2nd floor right above the pool and the noise wasn't too bad. It didn't bother my light sleeper kids. There was some noise from the hallway, the room doors always slammed shut and a fair amount of overhead thuds while trying to sleep one night. The room was large - 2 queens and sofa bed. I pulled the sofa bed out once for a nap, no way could an adult sleep comfortably on that, springy and noisy with every move. Sink area was tiny, but we managed ok. Bathroom was clean, no issues bathing the little ones. Plenty of towels too. Overall the hotel layout is goofy - placement of laundry, breakfast room, parking garages, and elevators. Just be aware. Breakfast was fine, as long as you were there early, they do warn you about that at check in. The room was large, there's just a lot of people staying there and it gets crowded. Good variety. There were lots of bad comments about parking, but we had no problem. The outside spots were very small, my minivan didn't fit well, but we always found a spot in the garage and the van fit just fine there. Freeway access was easy. Only 10 min to Sea World or the beach. Overall, we were quite satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cody N.”
Reviews.Author: Cody N
Reviews.Content: The overall facility was very very clean and very well maintained. Our room was very kept and no smells. Safe area to stay and park even a rental car. Breakfast was very good, a lot of people but that was because no one would move. My best experience of all was the front desk gentleman named Christian. He was super helpful and very informative. In this day and age it is hard to find great customer service, even good for that matter. Christian did an amazing job and i would recommend this place just because of his help and patience.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good!”
Reviews.Author: InsideTrack
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here again, making it our third stay in the last 5 years. And I can honestly say this hotel gets better every time. This hotel is extremely family friendly and appears to have been renovated quite recently. Staff are always attentive, professional and accomodating. Had occasion to be working on my laptop in the lobby where no one would've noticed me and I could hear the day manager (Juan?) training his staff. I was most impressed with the attitude he was trying to convey to them. Rooms are always clean and they have really user-friendly, remote controlled air-conditioning systems. The hotel is conveniently located and even sells passes for the local attractions. A free, continental breakfast is offered every day and there are even a few hot items. We are not big breakfast eaters, so this is ideal. We always request a room that has a king bed and an attached room with bunk beds for the kids (the room is separated by french doors). Although this type of room is not wheelchair accessible, all of the showers have handles and the hotel does provide shower chairs. Unfortunately, they do not provide wheelchairs so bring your own. We actually stayed here on two separate stops during our SoCal vacation and were pleased with the service and value both times. Over the last five years, we have stayed here another two times and the level of service is consistent. We look forward to staying here each time we come to San Diego. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “I will definately stay again !!”
Reviews.Author: Monica D
Reviews.Content: My Sister in Law and I arrrived Sept 8th, 2011 for my Son's homecoming from a deployment with the US Navy. We just so happened to have landed 2 hours prior to the largest blackout in San Diego's history. I was so impressed with the Staff's willingness to go above and beyond for their customers. Never did you see frustration in the faces of these employees. When I visit the San Diego area again, I will ONLY stay at this hotel. Great location, clean rooms, and once again, you could not ask for a friendlier staff... I didn't want to leave.. Great job ladies and gentlmen... GREAT JOB

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay, excellent value, delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki G
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family vacation at this hotel. Appreciated the friendly staff. Very responsive and prompt with calls to the front desk for more towels, soap, etc. While this is not on the beach (it is located within hotel circle), you cannot beat the accessibility to the expressway. Within minutes to the zoo, Balboa park, beaches. Only 45 minutes to LegoLand and San Diego zoo safari park. My kids LOVED to make their own breakfasts every morning with lots of choices. Swimming in the pool everyday was a great way to end the day. The kids suite with bunk beds were a real treat for the kids. Nice that the rooms were separated by a sliding door. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel!! We chose this hotel after reading previous opinions on trip advisor!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, hard working staff!”
Reviews.Author: EYEAVIATE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Hotel Circle so it is a heavily frequented property. It is easily accessible from the freeway and close to just about everything in San Diego which is why it is so busy. We stayed there for four nights on two different floors in two different rooms. Rooms are not overly large and have armoires instead of closets. It is an older hotel that has been updated so parts look new and some details tell its age. We had a double queen with a fold out couch and a second room with a king and bunk beds. The bunk bed concept is great with a room divider but be aware that the top bunk has a weight limit of 100 pounds so it is not an option for a larger pre-teen or teenager. The hotel was very clean and the hotel staff was constantly on the go cleaning, fixing, delivering - I was amazed at the logistics. Parking is mainly under the hotel and quite exciting! You will pay a nominal fee to park - cheaper than most in the area- and is limited and full all the time. Breakfast was not bad but they have a sign in the lobby about wait times for breakfast - 630 -730 easy, 730-830 moderate wait, 830-930 lines - and they are not joking. It was like a three ring circus free for all up there if you go late. FYI- the breakfast room is on the fourth floor near 4th floor rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Monica Z
Reviews.Content: I'll admit, I chose the hotel strictly on rate because we were sleeping over with the elephants at the Safari Park and then onto a resort property. What a lovely surprise to open the door to a HUGE room (#208) with a King bed, mini fridge, breakfast and wireless included. The Hunter Steakhouse next door was very convenient with good food/prices. Too bad the architects designed a cramped and crowded dining room for busy breakfast times. This is not a good place to eat if you are watching calories so we stuck to the hard boiled eggs and instant hot cereal with fruit. One morning we splurged on waffles and enjoyed them. We did notice popular food items such as bananas were replenished quickly. Easy to jump on the highway to get where we were going. Had 2 fantastic dinners up the road at the Handlery Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend family trip in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SalChoto
Reviews.Content: Our staying in this hotel was a good experience overall. I highly recommended for a weekend family trip in San Diego. The place was well maintained, it was a good value for our money, clean, and a family atmosphere hotel. This hotel is very ideal location, it's in between 5 and 8 freeways and with them you can go to all major attractions in San Diego. The hotel is near Sea World, Old Town San Diego, San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park. In addition, the hotel has a complementary breakfast which have different food such as eggs, fruits, cereal, bread, sausages, and others. It was a decent continental breakfast. Now, do I have some recommendation for the hotel staff: 1. Parking is not gated it, therefore it should be free. 2. Breakfast area is really too small for the amount of people the hotel host. Breakfast area should be expanded double capacity at least. 3. Have abundant of fruits and also replenish them. Overall, good experience and if we are going back to San Diego in a family trip; we would be staying back here in this Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “I was not thrilled wont be back!”
Reviews.Author: camper1982
Reviews.Content: I booked the room and received the itinerary with the grand total of 95.17.When i get there they tell me I also have an extra charge of 7.95 for parking.What a surprise my itinerary should have stated this. I get to my room and it smells like medicine and has a musty smell We cracked the window about 10 inches thats the most we could open . We went to pool where there were alot of bugs in the pool. We then went back to our room and it still smelled . We called the lobby and they sent up maint and maid which both said that it smelled too. We were able to move down the hall. This room was better. There is only one flourescent light for bathroom and no fan . Barely any light for sink and mirror area either. The room we had was on the side where the street was so there were peolple out there all night long doing i dont what. The eggs for breakfast were the consistency of pumpkin pie didnt even taste real..

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was great!”
Reviews.Author: kavya b
Reviews.Content: My family and me went on a vacation trip to San Diego. We chose Comfort inn and suites to stay at night. The room was comfortable and the service was good. They offer complimentary breakfast to all their guests which is pretty good. The food was great and the dining area was good too. Overall, it was worth the price and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Likely to Return”
Reviews.Author: denprich
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a disappointing experience due to the nature of the property more than anything else. The staff was friendly and check-in was speedy. The hotel is convenient to SeaWorld as expected but the hotel property is too small to provide adequate parking and the parking is extremely cramped/hard to enter and exit. Not only that, it costs $7.95 extra per day to park your car in a tiny little space. I expect parking to be included in my room rate. We were staying with 4 adults and 3 young children and had reserved two suites. The suites had been renovated to an extent and were tastefully decorated. Unfortunately, the suites are as cramped as the parking lot. It was difficult to get into the bathroom and close the door. The bathroom was so small that the sink was located away from the bathroom on the long wall of the bedroom. The room was quite warm until I discovered an overhead cooling unit in the bedroom that could be switched on to cool that area. The main HVAC unit was located in the small living room to the front of the suite. There was only very narrow space to walk between the wall and the beds to get to the living room area. With 3 adults, 2 children and 2 small strollers in our unit it was not easy to get around. The complimentary breakfast served on the 4th floor from 6:30 am to 9:30 am was a total ZOO. I guess that is why they call it Comfort Inn & Suites Zoo! The place was packed with people trying to get to the food and servers trying to keep the food supply stocked while people lucky enough to find food were trying to find a place at one of the few tables provided. The organization of the food buffet was very poor. People had to wander around finding food, silverware, napkins etc. that were not placed in a logical sequence. This added greatly chaos of a large number of guests trying to take advantage of the complimentary breakfast. Vending machine sodas, by the way, were $2.00 each. Other than that, I would say the beds were quite comfortable, and the room was really rather quiet so I did enjoy a good night's rest. Given the other detriments however, I would try a different hotel next time in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...works for families.”
Reviews.Author: gabbygang
Reviews.Content: Week long stay with four kids. Go early for breakfast!!! Parking is tight, but all of San Diego seems to be like that. Nice that there is a laundry room, but no where really to sit and wait. Our kids loved the pool and hot tub. Friendly, courteous staff....very helpful. love that there was microwave and fridge in room. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if a family”
Reviews.Author: phlyman
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. Front desk people were all very helpful. Room was always cleaned well. Hand-out directions and recommendations for restaurants was always highly accurate. Not noisy despite many rooms with children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay with your children.”
Reviews.Author: KandiCarter
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 children & myself stayed there the last week of July 2011. It was very busy in the dining room that morning, and the hotel had run out of fresh fruit. Our 6 year old has several food allergies and that was the only type of food the hotel served that would be okay for her. I went to the front desk to see if they could put more out, if they had it stocked. Ashley O. At the front desk went above and beyond the call of duty. She took it upon herself to track down a couple of apples for our daughter & delivered them to our room herself. If that wasn't enough, she took her break & personally went to the store to get a banana too. This meant the world to me & to my daughter, because of the lack of availability of safe food due to my daughter's allergies. Ashley O. took our situation seriously as soon as she realized how fatal the other foods in the hotel would have been for our daughter. I'm very impressed with her commitment to her job and appreciated so much that she followed through until a resolution was reached. The words "Thank You" just aren't enough so I hope this review will bring her positive recognition with her employer. Thanks again for wonderful service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice short stay, we would return.”
Reviews.Author: Chrisgutz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and so very close to Old Town San Diego and Sea World. We only stayed one night but were very comfortable. The room accomodated all of us with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. The room was very clean and very modern looking. Also, it was all very affordable. Check in was easy and staff was polite. There was free WIFI and a complimentary breakfast. Breakfast was very full of people, which is to be expected. But I thought the staff did a great job of keeping it stocked and cleaning off tables. We chose to eat there rather than take our food back to our rooms and we found a table quickly but had to wait a little bit to make our waffles. The breakfast selection included scrambled eggs, sausage, cereal options, danishes, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, waffles, juices, milk, and coffee. I did call for additional towels and they never brought them up. So I called back the following morning and they were sent up immediately. I enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good overall”
Reviews.Author: 1twinsmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my kids & my brothers family(in another room) in mid June.Hotel room and bathroom were clean and spacious.Hotel has been remodeled recently: lobby was vibrant, front desk people were all helpful and friendly; room had newer carpet, granite tops, modern decor,comfy sheets.My room was facing the highway &it can be loud especially during peak traffic times;it didn't bother me because I had the A/C on(pleasant white noise). So if you are sensitive to noise, request the other side of the bldg.Water pressure and temperature was great. I thought the breakfast area was small.I went for b-fast when it first opened and it was empty but 45 minutes later my brother went and told me it was very crowded. Food was the usual continental stuff: bagels, pastries, yogurt, breads, sausage,juices,coffee bananas &apples. Pool area was tiny, but who spends time @ the pool when the beaches are 15-20 minutes drive.My biggest complaint is the parking areas.I drive a minivan and there were few large parking spaces. It you drive a compact or mid size car its great, but anything bigger might be hard to find if the hotel is sold out or arrive back at the hotel after 9 pm. I would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: leecypoo
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because it had enough beds for everyone with the kids suite bunkbeds. without costing too much. We don't typically stay in the hotel much when we travel.The room was clean, modern looking, but cramped.The beds were very comfortable and we slept well. However....When we got to the room the bunk had a sign stating not to exceed 100lbs for the top bunk. Our teenagers weight more than that, they slept on it anyway, but that would have been nice to know when we booked the room for 4 adults. The vanity area is very tight and getting ready in the morning was rough. There was no table and we couldn't all sit in one room and watch tv together unless we piled on the king bed. The free breakfast was like a swap meet free for all, and after getting in line to empty trays and no where to sit, we just went out for breakfast. The floor above us sounded like a herd of elephants was housed up there. My minimum requirements for enough beds, cleanliness, and safety were all met, so I would stay again. Ask for a fouth floor room to keep the noise down and get to breakfast early and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmsouth
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT hotel for families!!! It is very clean and staff is very nice & helpful to any need you may have. On site coin Washer/Dryers great benefit too! I would definately recommend this hotel to any family with children. Great location & easy access to freeway. Money well spent! Try this hotel you'll have a great stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but no parking”
Reviews.Author: kajun213
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 recently stayed here for three nights in a kid suite. The room was nice and clean and overlooked the pool. The kids had their own room with bunk beds. The pool and hot tub were nothing special, but the kids enjoyed swimming and after long days of walking, the hot tub was nice. The free breakfast was probably the best part of the entire hotel. The main downside to this hotel, was that parking cost $8 per night yet there was none. We ended up getting a spot away from everthing and took taxi's around so we wouldn't lose it. The free wifi only worked half the time, and the freeway right behind the hotel was quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: RaZre
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days during our trip to cali. Room was clean. Comfortable beds. Very affordable and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “2nd trip here, same good experience”
Reviews.Author: Mickimouz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my family in the kid's suite. This is the 2nd year in a row we have stayed here - mostly because we love the separate room with bunk beds for the kids. As mentioned in some other reviews, breakfast can be crowded & hectic especially later in the mornings, and while the eggs left something to be desired, there are other options available, but no complaints because it's free. Parking is cheaper (under $8) than most nearby properties. As an added bonus, there is a laundry room, and the front desk usually has quarters available. The staff at both visits were consistantly courteous and professional. We will be staying here again. My only recommendation to the hotel would be somehow quiet the doors on the stairwells. My room was immediately adjacent and the doors slammed regularly, woke us up several times during the night. Last time we stayed here we were 2 rooms down, and it wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Updated rooms are of great quality!”
Reviews.Author: humu1
Reviews.Content: My family and I were amazed with the appearance and quality of the updated rooms. The updates carried into the continental breakfast area on the 4th floor with granite counters and modern lighting. The large number of people crowding the eating are made it hectic, though. The only real problems were with the service. They did not have my reserved accessible room set aside, altough a solution was eventually arranged. Also, i witnessed several guests reporting problems with their room keys. Overall, though, this was a very comfortable hotel, thus their title I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the price”
Reviews.Author: mom2ckm
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical staying here since it was pretty low price for a family of 5. We got a suite, a room of two double beds seperated with another room containing a sofa bed. The room was tight but it was clean and the beds were comfortable. Bathroom was clean but small. The sink was separated and was located nextto the beds which i thought was a little weird. It was nice that they had free breakfast even though it was a basic breakfast with average to low quality ingredients but with kids that pick at food it worked for us. Overall the place was a good value for how much you are spending. Its no luxury hotel but its clean and hotel staff was nice. Great place for a family on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Best for Kids Suites”
Reviews.Author: maxiwhite
Reviews.Content: We went to sea world and stayed here, Rooms were nice and clean We stayed in a Kids suite, good breakfast and excellent customer service. close to all the major attraction sea world, zoo. price wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: clmccormick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a family vacation. Loved the kid suite, the kids had their own section of the room with bunk beds, a tv, and a sliding door divided the two parts of the room. The room was clean and nice, not huge, but fine. We happened to be next to a room that was very loud late at night, but that wasn't the hotel's fault (and we returned the favor with our two-year old's temper tantrums in the morning, so I guess all is fair). Amenities were nice, wi fi was free and worked with good speed, pool was nice, and breakfast was very good. Parking is an additional fee. Convenient location for Balboa Park, SeaWorld, and many beach areas (La Jolla, Torrey Pines, etc.). We had a pleasant experience and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sheasmom04
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed here with our young children. We LOVED everything about our stay!! The staff were super friendly, always greeting us as we passed and they were very friendly to our children. To me its a very big plus when a hotel offers a breakfast buffet but sometimes the food selection can be a dissapointment. I must say the variety they have to offer made me and my daughter happy. Oh and the fact that they had the disney channel on for the kids, a big plus in my book! The location of the hotel is great. Only mintues from Sea World, mall, resturants and15 mintues from downtown San Diego. The rooms were fantastic! We were pleasently surprised to walk into our room and see a pull out couch. The extra space came in handy when you have two small kids who like to run around and play!! The one and ONLY problem I had was there were not enough parking spaces. One night out of the 3 we stayed, there were no available parking and I was left to park in the resturant located nextdoor. But upon telling the front desk staff, they waved my parking fee for the night! I will definitely be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Idea hotel with kids”
Reviews.Author: Createandbuild
Reviews.Content: We booked the kids suite, i was a little unsure from the reviews but it was the only hotle close to sea world with kids suites avaliable. It was perfect having two kids. There was a room with bunk beds and tv for the kids with sliding door leading from the main bedroom. We arrived late with the kids and needed something to eat, the hunters resturant next door was perfect for us

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: George_and_Veronica
Reviews.Content: Coupon rate was $60@night. Very comfortable accomodations. Location a little difficult to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, few issues”
Reviews.Author: london1651
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Comfort Inn for 3 nights with my family. It was a great hotel room! Comfortable beds and a lot of room, being that I was staying with my fiancee and our 3 children. There were 2 queen sized beds and a sofa with a pull out bed. Perfect accomidations for everyone. The hotel offers a continental breakfast, which is good, but gets tiresome after a couple of days. Yet, for a continental breakfast, it was fresh and pretty good choices. The sitting area is small and chaotic, so an expansion on that would be nice. Now for the negatives. You need to pay $7.95 for parking per night, per vehicle. Ridiculous!! Where else is a customer supposed to park when staying at a hotel? You would think that that would be included in the crazy rate that you already pay. Also, I was charged a $49.00 fee (I suppose for a security deposit), $25.00 for parking (again, RIDICULOUS!), and a $30.00 fee that when I asked the employee what that was for, she tells me "I have no idea." How can I be charged for something that not even the employee had any clue about? The lighting in the bathroom was dim and the mini fridge was going back and forth from 44 degrees to 52 degrees, all on its own. All in all, nice comfortable motel, but watch your credit card charges. They seem a bit charge crazy! Also, scope the area for some free parking (which would be hard to find), and we were on the pool side of the motel, and the noise from loud swimmers until 10pm was annoying, but I read in other reviews that the freeway side isn't much better. This hotel was close to everything like Sea World, beach, and the Zoo, so it is an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Friendly - Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: lostdownsouth
Reviews.Content: Make sure you get a newly renovated room, facing the north (to avoid the highway noise), and make sure your A/C works! Not a bad place, this year we decided to extend our vacation by a week and stay at kid friendly budget hotels whereas we normally only stay at newly renovated Hampton, Wingate, Holiday Inn Express, etc. on the low side, or resorts. This wasn't bad, it was pretty clean, but still "lipstick on a pig" to some degree. It's real close to the highway, real close to Sea World or the beaches (5 min). I'd stay here again, it seemed better than some of the other budget choices in the area which other family members booked at. For breakfast, although they have a light offering, I would recommend visiting Ricky's (across the highway, short drive).

Reviews.Title: “Nicely upgraded, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJtheDJLA
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here many years ago under different owership and always enjoyed the property. Now the Comfort Inn owners have remodled and upgraded at least 80% of the hotel. Beds were real comfortable, shower was good, and large rooms with most amenities you need. Good flat-screen tv and a mini fridge. I was quite comfortable. I'll pass along some "could be better" items which some will appreciate knowing: The sink and cabinetry are outside of the actual bathroom. This can cut both ways. Lighting in the bathroom is poor from the single cfl bulb. No micro. Door closures are very noisy up and down the hall. Wireless internet connection seems slow. Parking is an extra cost. Location is a good one for getting almost anywhere you need to go around San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “It as okay for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Familyof6Vacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our vacation in Southern California. The location was great for us since we were there to see Old Town, SeaWorld and the Zoo. The rooms were small for our family of 6, but it did the trick for a few nights. Seemed fairly clean and the kids loved the pool area. Staff was friendly enough and were always helpful. Breakfast was busy but good. The only real complaint that I have about this hotel was the bathroom fan! It was super loud and there was no way of turning on the light without the fan coming on as well. Made it hard for me to start my day without disturbing anyone who chose to sleep a little longer!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cramped, and NOISY”
Reviews.Author: yoamoja
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a one night stay with kids. Easy check in, except for the front desk clerk was very rude. Not sure if she was having a bad day or if it was normal attitude. Went to our room, was not the suite I was told about on the phone reservations, let the front staff know about the problem, instead of offering a solution, asked me if I wanted to check out. I declined, why put my family through all the hassle of moving bags and trying to find another hotel on a Saturday night. To make a long story short, the two room suite was very small. I am sure the hotel staff may say it isn't a two room suite, but it's small, really small. I think the worst part of my stay at this hotel was the thin walls. Very thin walls. I have never been at a more noisy hotel. I was in room 224. Avoid that room at all costs. I had the people above me stomping, I could hear them talking all night, and I could hear their TV shows. I could also hear the people in the next room talking as well. Like I mentioned, the hotel was clean, the room was clean, but if you are looking for a place for your family to get a good night sleep and rest. It's not going to happen here. It is very LOUD. Also the rooms are really small.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: stacey003
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rate, clean room, nice continental breakfast (but very busy), clean & very warm pool. We had a king size bed and two pac n plays for our 20 month old twins and still had a ton of floor space for the toddlers to play. Great customer service, friendly staff and very helpful. Good location between the Zoo and Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay,clean,and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: anna121673
Reviews.Content: The stay was great, there was no problems with the pool, security, breakfast, or the comfort of this hotel. Yes, the rooms are small if you have a suite but the value is great. The breakfast was a busy place, I recommend going when they open or after 845. There is some noise but what can you expect if you have children. This is a kid friendly hotel. I did not find anything unsanitary. The location was within beaches, Sea World, Zoo, Gaslamp area, Harbor and the Historic downtown. There was a total of 6 people in our room, 3 adults and 3 kids. The sofa bed was a little uncomfortable as stated by my husband but overall it was a great place....Also parking is a $7.95 a night but I seen security at night so worth it knowing that it was watched..

Reviews.Title: “Will look for something else next time”
Reviews.Author: geddesg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. THe only people I found friendly were the front desk people. They were very helpful. Room was on the 4 th floor. Very small.. it was the kids suite. Ok I guess for one night but no longer with a child. After we got unpacked we found our air did not work. They sent up maintenance who told me they'd fix it in 20 minutes but didn't have the part. They offered to move us but I had unpacked already. My daughter is handicapped so it isn't easy to pick up and move. Internet was HORRIBLE. Very slow... pool was nice and clean.. but not warmed up to 84 degrees like they said. Breakfast was good.. lots of people but that is to be expected. Will try to find somewhere else next time unless they are willing to cut me a deal for smothering to death for the day with no air in a stuffy room. Walls are very thin. One other thing.. very shady motel across the street. Beware! Saw the cops there numerous times and when we checked in.. they had one person in handcuffs! not the best area.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: DarkRyder
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds, nice size room, we got the 2 queens beds and a sofa bed..perfect for our 2yr old.. we were there for 3 nights and 4 days.. not enough dresser space.. the breakfast its called a buffet..but its really continental breakfast..i have to say that was our biggest disappointment!!! Close to many places we were going to visit...We would stay here again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location- Ok Stay”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasIsHome
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW- Smelly 1st room- dirty, and noisy. 2nd Room- much nicer- clean and quite. Free Internet was the worst I ever expericenced! We stayed in the kids rooms suite- 1king bed and bunkbeds. It was small at first, but we got use to it. Check in was slow- it was about 9:00pm and they only had 1 person at the front desk and she was busy on the phone. Got to the room and it was smelly -like sewer; we were really tired so we opened the windows and ran the fresh air, got better but not great. The walls are PAPER THIN! At 1AM in the room next to us a baby started to cry and I thought it was in the same room with us. It went on all night. Then the next morning my daughter found corn chips in her bed....she did not eat any corn chips the night before. So with the stink, the chip and crying baby, we asked for a differnent room. They moved us to the 4th floor. What a difference, no smell, no chips, clean and quite! Our toilet broke one morning and they came right up and fixed it. The breakfast was like a circus, but that is how they all are. Basic food- good. The location is a little odd to find, but great once you do. It is 2 quick turns and you are back on the freeway. Internet was horrible! Impossible to use, even at 4 am when you are awaken by a crying baby! The kids loved the bunkbed, and location, we would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: lfenn525
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week with our 10 month old daughter. Check in was fast and easy. We decided to upgrade to the kids suite so my daughter would have her own area to sleep so my husband and I wouldn't have to go to bed when she did! The room was great! A little smaller than I was expecting but for the price ($99/night) I really couldn't complain. The room was clean and the sliding door was perfect to give my daughter the quiet she needed for naps and at bedtime. The staff was friendly and pleasant. We had an issue with the tv's and remotes not working. We called down to the first desk and someone came up to the room in minutes and replaced the batteries. We also requested a crib at check in and again within minutes one was delivered to our room. The free breakfast in the morning was great as well. Nothing fancy...but then again its FREE! They had bagels, cereal, juice, coffee, fruit and make it yourself waffles...that were delicious! The location of the hotel is great too. It is close to all the area attractions such as sea world, the zoo, seaport village and old town. Overall we had a great experience and would definitely stay here again if we come back to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: JPDC_7
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Comfort Inn. The location is close to the freeways and easy driving distance to the attractions. We had two adults and four kids and the room was very nice with two full beds and a sofa bed. The staff were friendly and housekeeping kept the room clean. The free breakfast was very convenient and the kids were happy. They also enjoyed the pool and hot tub. The only downside is the bathroom is very small with the sink in the room and the sofa bed was like sleeping in a hammock.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Baguirre
Reviews.Content: Clean, staff was super nice, convenient location, breakfast was aweeesssooommme! You can make your own waffles.! Overall it was a great deal and everything was CLEAN and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel022
Reviews.Content: Got a fantastic deal for two nights here. Was very happy with the room. Updated and modern. Comfortable bed. Able to open the windows for fresh air. Great location-love staying on Hotel Circle because it's convenient to many attractions. Check-in was easy. Computers and printer in lobby were a lifesaver (do have to pay, but it's not too bad if you're not staying on it for a length of time)!! Lots of options for food nearby if you're able to drive and many delivery options late night/24hrs. Only negatives I can say were the lighting in the bathroom (extremely dark!), found a child's toy truck next to the bed (not sure how they missed this if they thoroughly cleaned the room?), and had to pay for parking but wasn't super expensive so I can overlook that. Overall, would definitely stay here again for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: johnnleah
