Reviews.Content: We were just her for an overnight stay because my daughter had a cheer competition in SDSU and we had to be there so early. This place is kind of centrally located as far as San Diego attractions go. But just to warn you, you won't get any of those scenic SD views if you stay at this place, just a view of the freeway. But when you visit SD, you never want to waste too much time staying in your hotel anyway, with the great weather year round, you should be outside. Plus there are several high end hotels on the exact same street with the same views of the freeway. At first I was skeptical after such a bad experience at the Ramada Carlsbad just a month ago where the pictures were so misleading. I even tried to change last minute to the Sheraton LaJolla since I saw several bad reviews but it was too late, so I hopes for the best. When we first drove up, I thought "not another Ramada"- the outside needed some updating. But when we walked in, I was pleasantly surprised how clean and updated it was, all the way up to our room which slept 6, 2 queens and a pull out couch. You could take this same room and put it within a Mariott or Hyatt that we've previously stayed in. When we stayed at the Ramada by the sea just several miles from here for the same price. What a nightmare! It was so gross and dirty and stinky. This place is a hundred times better. The pictures didn't lie this time. I would highly recommend this to my friends and stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: dtjtfam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel, along with a group of out of town guest, for our daughter's October wedding. After reading several negative reviews we were alittle apprehensive about our stay however we were greeted by friendly, helpful staff at the desk and were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of our rooms. Whenever any of our party had a problem it was taken care of in a very efficient manner. The complimentary breakfast offered waffles,bagels, pastries, cereals, fruit, juices etc. More than enough to start your day! The housekeeping staff were friendly and kept the beds made and the towels plentyful. Wherever you went in the hotel, down a hall, pool, laundry area, reception area everything was neat and clean. Sea World, the Zoo, the mall, Target, and a ton of resturants are only minutes away. This hotel is located at the very end of the street and there is some road construction going on that you have to manuever around to get to the hotel but we had a very pleasant stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom072
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Comfort Inn & Suites Zoo/SeaWorld Area for 5 nights with our young children while in the area vacationing in March 2010. There was a bit of a mix-up with the room at first. We booked a family room that had a separate room with pull-out couch; however what they put us in at first was a room that wasn't the "family" room....instead, it just had 2 double beds. It was pretty crowded and we really wanted the set-up with the separate room for the kids, so we pushed on it and asked to be moved which they did the next day. The switch was somewhat confusing, as there were people that were still in the room that we got moved into and I think they were a bit surprised by our presence. In any case, eventually it was all worked out and we were settled in the family room. The room set-up was adequate and the kids enjoyed having their own separate space. Rooms were clean. Hotel was conveniently located to many area attractions. All in all, a pretty good value. The breakfast room was crowded and busy and the set-up could have been more efficient to move people through, but it was a great amenity to have to start the day. We only used the pool/hot tub a couple times; they were fine.

Reviews.Title: “too basic for the price”
Reviews.Author: princess_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: location is ok if driving; the only walkable place is a steakhouse (I would recomend it for lunch/dinner) Even though it feels new and clean, I was dissappointed for the price it lacked character or at least all the details/comfort should have been thought through. (not enough lighting, no places to hang towels, etc.) San Diego has a great public transportation, so next time. I'll pick something close to it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MaryChristmas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the hotel - its the second year in a row we have stayed at this hotel - we have stayed in about half a dozen in the area - but we consider this one the best in the hotel circle when you consider location and value for money. Rooms are modern, immaculately cleaned - always loads of hot water, fresh fluffy towels, The breakfast is fantastic - if you are travelling with a family it is a perfect start to the day - great location, the beaches are a couple of minuted drive away - short trip away to shops, bars and restaurants downtown San Diego a quick ride away on the MTS or in the car. The hotel staff are friendly, and can not do enough for you to make your stay perfect. I can recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good location - great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accomodations for a reasonable price - a great find”
Reviews.Author: PoipuKapele
Reviews.Content: We feel very fortunate to have found this particular hotel - it was referenced in an earlier review and we thought we'd take a chance. Our 5 day stay was beyond our expectations. The hotel was recently renovated so our room was clean and attractive with free 'responsive' Internet. The grounds & hotel exterior were well kept. The breakfast area was very busy, but the crew kept up with the demands. The front desk was always gracious and the entire staff was very pleasant. The maid services were exceptional and timely. Security was on the premises. The parking area had large & small stalls and was a steal at $6.95 per day considering other hotels in the vincinity charged $10-$26 per day. The restaurant next door was very good and not too expensive since they had specials. We would definitely stay here again if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let the Pictures Fool You . . .”
Reviews.Author: laxmom25
Reviews.Content: When looking for a room for one night, I thought this hotel looked nice enough for my husband and daughter. We had one room with two queen beds. Check-in was easy enough, even though they told me they would be putting $50 on my check/debit card for "incidentals" that would not be refunded to me for 4-5 days. When I inquired as to what sort of "incidentals" I would be charged for, I really got no specific answer. I kind of just agreed with it and moved on. Next, we arrived in our room tired and in need of a shower after moving our son into his college dorm that day. Discovered there was no shower curtain and no towels! And there was dirt in the bathtub! Everything else looked clean, except the windows, which were filthy, so I called the desk to let them know what we were missing. Said they would be right up with the missing items. Well, 25 minutes later, the items arrived. (Why it took so long, I don't know. It's not that big of a hotel.) The man handed my husband the towels and shower curtain. We had to put the curtain up ourselves. The sink area was a bit cramped. The breakfast area was packed when we went to eat. There was a football team, so of course, lots of kids and parents. Waffle line is a joke. One lady monopolized the darn machine for 20 minutes. Maybe a little sign limiting you to two at a time might be an idea. It was getting ugly in there! Tables needed to be cleaned, but the staff was in no hurry to clean them. The mattresses were not very comfortable, and we will not be staying here again. Too many other choices in better part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Damp room with wet carpet and horrible smell”
Reviews.Author: nztraveller101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during a month long stay in the USA. Of the many hotels we stayed in this was the second worst. There were two positives - the rooms were not a bad size and yes it had been recently redecorated but there was a damp smell that was noticeable in the room as soon as we arrived and the carpet felt wet to walk on. In the morning there was water dripping from the windows. Like many of the other reviews breakfast was pretty bad - long queues and the food wasn't very good. When we checked out and I complained about the room the front desk staff couldn't have cared less - I suppose we should have asked to move as soon as we checked in but we had had a busy day at Seaworld and really only wanted a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “So-so hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: judiecwm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while visiting SeaWorld. Great location and easy access to the freeway. We stayed ina kids suite and the boys loved their bunk beds and separate room. The other room for adults was cramped with furniture (the wardrobe takes a lot of space and doesn't hold much, but there was no closet) and tended to be dark (the kids' room has the window). Breakfast was crowded but fine except for our last day. At the waffle line (three waffle makers), two women were making waffles for their entire families (at least 4 or 5 apiece), and I stood in line for at least 20 minutes. Maybe the hotel could suggest folks make 2 waffles during peak periods? Anyway, aside from those inconsiderate ladies, folks were generally nice. Front desk staff was supremely unhelpful, though. I asked where the closest gas station was and the staff couldn't tell me. Compared to another hotel we stayed at in Carlsbad during this trip, it was clear that these staff members didn't give a hoot about helping us out or making sure we had a good experience. Next time, I think we'll stay in Carlsbad and just drive a little farther. (We stayed during Comic-Con, so hotel was crowded.) Also found it frustrating that hotel charged (by the minute) to use their business center computers or printers. (We needed to print out boarding passes for our flight home.) We already paid for the room and for parking. Adding this cost on just seemed punitive. Also had wi-fi trouble, like another guest mentioned, but I called the 800 number for help and was able to resolve.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Moncana
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this Comfort Inn and Suites and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel has all the basic amenities a family would need and is very close to all the popular attractions, like Sea World, the beaches, Old Town San Diego and Downtown. The staff was nice, check in process was quick and painless. The room was a decent size and the beds were comfortable. We really enjoyed the pool and the convenience of the business center. We were able to buy our Sea World tickets online and print them right there at the hotel. We also enjoyed having free WiFi in our room. Breakfast was OK, just your basic continental breakfast....and yes, it was busy! But this is a busy hotel. We had no issues with parking, there was always a spot available. The only thing we missed was having a microwave in the room, and we did notice the carpet in the room was dirty, so just wear shoes or socks when walking on it.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay - two bed suite”
Reviews.Author: yeartolate
Reviews.Content: The good. The room was comfortable enough. The set up was ok, although the bathroom was a bit tight. My son liked the living room area with his own flat screen tv. I thought the 6.95 parking was more than fair, but I wish the super sized cars would park in appropriate spots. :). It was centrally located, every place we wanted to go in San Diego was about 5 minutes away. The beds were comfortable enough, not 4 star lush, but comfortable. The pool area was clean. Housekeeping did a great job. The iffy. We got to the hotel after three and our room was not ready. Not a big deal, but the front desk, instead of apologizing, said that 3pm is only when they "start checking in". That of course is baloney. What kinda took me off guard was something posted that said it was ok to check out late......well.....it certainly is NOT ok when it makes a guest wait in the lobby for their room to get ready. The breakfast area had a decent spread, but it was really crowded. We never came close to getting a chance at a waffle.The line was way too long. But they had good muffins.Plenty of cereal, juice, coffee, hot chocolate, fruit. Lots of available seating, but also alot of noisy kids and babies. Very noisy. The room was pretty noisy - the folks/kids upstairs both nights sounded like they were playing basketball - not much noticable outside noise. But the activity upstairs was crazy. The elevators were very slow, The laundry room was decent, but the dryers were too hot even on the delicate setting. Lots of wi-fi issues - poor connection. Funny thing is that the "Premeir Hotel" acriss the street had a better connection capability - it came in at three bars and comfort came in at 1-2 bars. It was prety frustrating. Wish they had a movie channel (like major hotels do - recent releases) We would stay there again if the price was much lower. (I think we paid $126/night for the suite.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but awful front desk”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelr88
Reviews.Content: Great location and it was a great budget deal. Problem was at check-in the front desk staff was very courteous. Problem was when we called in about information when we arrived at the airport, the male who picked up the phone was extremely rude. Not only did he hang up on us twice, but he said vulgar things to my son and I. When I got to the hotel and asked about this, we were given the runaround and the staff told us that their phone lines had been hijacked. I found that to be very suspicious and I still don't think that was entirely true. Besides that occurence, everything else was great, the maid was accomodating in the morning, and the rooms were oldish but comfortable enough for a short stay. Who spends time in the room anyway! Location was supreme and I felt safe there with my son.

Reviews.Title: “basketball tourney- great deal for the team to stay”
Reviews.Author: pat-artesia
Reviews.Content: we booked 5 rooms for the girls basketball team for a 4 day tourney. Since the games were played at most of the surrounding colleges the ease of the freeway access made it so easy to get around. The suites worked out great for the girls, with the free breakfast, the microwave, the refrigerators and the pool. They even allowed us to have a dinner out by the pool, of course we cleaned up our mess. The staff was very welcoming and happy. The breakfast was good but go early if it is summer or a weekend. Lots of variety enough to keep the kids happy and hold them over until lunch.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was excellent. Breakfast was...”
Reviews.Author: limpey3
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent. Breakfast was okay. There is a lot of construction in area and the air would go warm in the morning hours and last they charge for parking in the hotel where we are already paying to sleep in. all in all it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and price”
Reviews.Author: Indy-Gurl-317
Reviews.Content: After searching for hotels for a week stay, I finally settled on this hotel. Reading all these reviews I do not know what hotel they were staying at. Everyone complained about it being close to the freeway...WOW my window was the freeway view and we heard NO noise. The only noise we heard was the grass being mowed. There was construction going on too, NO NOISE either!!!! I wonder where they stayed at. As for parking $6.95 wow u cannot beat that compare to what all the other hotels were charging. There was not enough parking spaces for the number of rooms there. The spaces are super close, I had trouble opening my door and me and the car next to me were in the lines like we should be. I had the Larger king room, and it was nice and small, nothing large about it. The only thing that I did not like about the room was there were no dressor drewers to put clothing in. I felt like I was living out of my suite case and I hate that feeling. I stay in the Marriott all the time and I have the living space to not feel like I am living in a suite case. Now the " hot breakfast" was totally not a hot breakfast, the only thing they have is waffle mix and a waffle maker, that did not work half the time. I end up going to Walmart to get food and to Denny's for the remaining of my 5 days there. Only used the breakfast area 2 days. Then they also have hard boiled eggs which were over cooked and rubber like and bagels, muffins and cream cheese. No fruit or yogert at all. A big tip its nice that they have free wi-fi, but if you need to print your boarding pass you have to use your credit card just to access their main computer and then they charge you for $1 for each page that gets printed out...I end up spending $5 just to print off my boarding passes. REALLY is it that deep to charge just to look up something on the internet and you already charge FREE internet in the room. What a waste!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, price, rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: ladybeeg
Reviews.Content: After seraching many hotels for a weekend with our adult children, their spouses and a 3 year old grandaughter I settled on this hotel. The price was very good and I hoped it would live up to it's pictures on the website. It more than met our needs. We had 3 different rooms and all were very good. Clean, updated rooms and facilities. Flat screen TV, comfortable beds and free wi-fi. We spent all day Saturday at the zoo and Sunday morning we all relaxed by the pool before heading home. The morning breakfast was a nice start to the day - typical Continental breakfast food but just fine to give you a cup of coffee and muffin to start the day. Other items were available as well. Great for kids first thing in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: argonauts52
Reviews.Content: Location is close to seaworld and the zoo. Hotel is pretty large. Disappointed with having to pay for parking. Rooms were decorated nicely with good furniture. Rooms were nicer than expected. Good location off of expressway, but that naturally brings noise. I was overall pleased with my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware- Pictures are decieveing!!! Dont Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: BreenDex
Reviews.Content: We did a little research and read some reviews before I picked thishotel. The pictures looked so nice but believe be, don't let the pictures decieve you. Don't stay here! We stayed in a family bunk bed suite. It was humid and Dark and very Noisey by the freeway! We couldn't even open our window. The air flow in the room was is TERRIBLE. The hotel is super old and the picture does not show you how old it is! The elevator permits were all expired and very slow. We took the smelly, stairs which smelled like human urine most of our time. I was really debating about checking out but we decided to just stick it out The " hot breakfast" was totally not a hot breakfast, the only thing they have is waffle mix and a waffle maker. They also have hard boiled eggs which were coled and bagels, muffins and cream cheese. No fruit at all, and did i mention it was super crowded! Our kids suite is no suite at all, it is a normal size room separated by french doors and then they squeezed bunk beds in the room. Okay so when we first got to there, the house keepers never clened the furniture off, we walked in to a semi-dirty room with spilt milk on the table.Also the french doors were not working and the bottom piece was broken. We called the front office and they said they would call us back.. they never did! We had to call back the following day, then they sent someone up to fix it. The furniture was broke down... This is really a 1-2 start hotel! Save your money and stay at the marriot or doubletree who also has kids suites.Also you hear kids running the hallways late at night, this didnt bother me to much since i knew it was a kid friendly hotel. This hotel was just really gross and we will NEVER stay here again.... We stayed 3 nights and spent $496.... What a waste!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCRAPBOOKINGFAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and we were overall pleased. The hotel was clean and the room was nice. We enjoyed the pool area while we were there. We also liked the continental breakfast, but was not expecting to wait as long as we did. There were so many people lined up to get in!! I could see why, the food was delicious. The parking was terrible!! There was not enough spaces it seemed for how many room cause we had to circle the parking lot a few times and the spots are so tight. Overall, it was a good stay just be careful what you have to park there and wake up first thing in morning to enjoy breakfast without the long wait.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rstark75utah
Reviews.Content: We really didn't have any problems with this hotel. For those traveling due to business this is not the place for you. I've seen a lot of complaints about how the breakfast is so busy and the place is so noisy. This is a family oriented hotel. You can't really expect much else. I agree about the parking. Regardless of numerous comments, the person responding to these reviews has no control over the expansion of parking. It was not fun coming back from Disneyland at 2 AM and needing to spend 20 minutes trying to find a place to park. I was finally told I could park in the restaurant parking lot neighboring the hotel provided I moved it early enough. Alas, that is my only complaint and If I stay in San Diego again with family, I will come here. The place is easy enough, just check in, and relax.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place”
Reviews.Author: Karthic
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel . Good breakfast . Near to the zoo , sea world and other attractions . Courteous staff .

Reviews.Title: “Do not confuse with the Comfort Inn Hotel Circle.... This one is Hotel Circle PLACE... completely different!”
Reviews.Author: HomeIsBest01
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has been completely modernised. Has a beautiful lobby, parking is not so good but we never had a problem with parking. The room was excellent and a releif when we walked in with a 20month old child. The room was very modern and had everything you could want. Fab decor, 2 x comfy beds and bedding, a sofa, wardrobe, flat screen tv, bathroom with bath and shower, seperate sink area, plenty of clean towels, fridge and coffee maker - was perfect for getting to the Stadium, San Diego Zoo and Seaworld. Breakfast was basic and typical for many American hotels. Buffet style cereal toast waffles etc. Our room was situated on the back of the building facing the freeway and right underneath the illuminated hotel sign, the noise from the traffic was audible and could be irritating (although not to us) but the light from the sign was not at all as blackout curtains are used. The pool area is very nice although we had to walk through the carpark to get to it, but worth it when you get there. towels are supplied. Overall I would recommend this hotel, but beware not to get it confused as there are 2 comfort inn & suites on Hotel Circle, this one is on Hotel Circle Place.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoJetjr
Reviews.Content: We reserved the Two Room Kids Suite mostly because my 6-yr old daughter gets a kick out of having her own space (although she does have her own room at home). The room was spacious and comfy (3rd floor overlooking the pool). Hotel is located close to the Airport, Malls, eateries, old town, and more. It's pretty easy to get around. Noticed that they included a mini split ac/heater in the main bedroom. Of course, as luck has it, I couldn't figure out how to use it. But, it wasn't needed. The only hiccup was that the bathtub and sink were clugged upon arrival. But a quick call to the front desk and a maintenance person was immediately dispersed to take care of the problem. Terrific response. On the next day, the toilet was clugged. Honest, it wasn't me (think it was the wife). Any whooo, front desk was called and problem quickly resolved. Continental breakfast was good. Waffles, boiled eggs, cereal, coffee, cappiccino (sp), muffins, etc.. Did love the fresh hot waffles. Pour mix, turn griddle, wait for beep. Of course, I found out later that you should spray the griddle first with oil before pouring the mix. But, I got it right on the second batch. Overall, the staff's service was excellent. Hotel room and breakfast was great. Although, I don't think I'll want another waffle or cappicino for a few months. It can play havoc on your digestive system. We're planning to visit Legoland this May and more than likely will stay at the Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great price and location, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: littlecaesar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a kids suite which is a king bed in one section and a bunk bed in another, separated by French doors. The room itself was pretty nice for a 2.5 star hotel. It was clean. Decor was nice and furniture/beds were comfortable. The parking lot is a little hard to maneuver, especially if you have a large car. Luckily we only had a compact. Spaces are tight. The elevator is small and slow. I thought the complimentary breakfast was fine. It's your basic continental breakfast offerings - danish, cereal, bagels, toast, hard boiled eggs, fruit and coffee/milk/juice. They also have a make your own waffle station which my husband did and said was fine. My main complaint is that there is really no noise insulation in the rooms. You can hear people talking and laughing in the hallway right outside your door. This woke us up several times both late in the evening and early in the morning. There was also a lot of noise from our neighbors. We could hear it every time they went to the bathroom when they turned on the bathroom light which has a fan. We could hear them opening and closing their squeaky closet door. We had a room on the opposite side of the freeway facing the pool, so we didn't really hear much freeway noise. But we did hear some noise from the streets a few times. Nothing too bad though. Of course in the day you'll hear noise from the pool. The location was great for us. We were in San Diego mainly to go to SeaWorld and the Zoo and traveling with our 2 year old. It is close by to Mission Valley Shopping Mall where we could walk around and find a place to eat. And also close to Old Town. All in all, it wasn't a terrible stay. We really wanted a kids suite since our 2 year old goes to sleep by 8p, so this was perfect. We got a good deal on Expedia (under $100) so the price was great. They do charge $6.95/day for parking, so keep that in mind. Also, if you get the kids suite, you should be aware that the French doors that separate the two sections have glass panes with only a very thin sheer curtain covering them. I used blankets to stick over the sheer curtains so as to make the kids side dark when our daughter when to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Find a Different Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tylersewell104
Reviews.Content: Although the room was cozy and the lady at the front was nice, our experience was severely worsened by the housekeeping banging on the door at 9 in the morning. Check out time was noon and we were still asleep. They then proceeded to open the door, but luckily we had the top lock on it. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sweetrayne
Reviews.Content: I am not a picky traveler, especially when we are there for attractions and don't really spend time in the hotel room itself. What I do expect is a clean. comfortable room. This was far from that! Our first night, we had roaches, so they switched us to the room next to elevators. The room was dirty with stains on the carpet and noisy. The walls are paper thin! There are plenty of hotel options on Hotel Circle, so take head and do some research! We ended up leaving a day earlier because we were disappointed with this hotel. The pictures of this hotel are very deceiving!!!

Reviews.Title: “Photos are not a good representation.”
Reviews.Author: lesliessk8
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. The bed was too soft and only had a sheet, one thin blanket and another sheet on top. No comforter, quilt or warm blanket. Was cold all night. The pictures showed there was supposed to be a blanket folded across the bed....none. Room was right next to the on/off ramp of the 8 freeway, so the morning traffic was very noisey. There are plenty of hotels on Hotel Circle, will choose a different one on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you don't care about breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gma6768
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, clean with contemporary furnishings and a completely tiled bathroom. It was also well sound insulated. The front desk was helpful and happy. The breakfast facility and food offered were a big disappointment.. too limited for the number of guests. Parking was also somewhat difficult with spaces hard to find and get into and out of. Finally I would say that the building exterior needs a good cleaning!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value, Great Location and Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: soona99
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very large, the double queen bedroom also contained a full size couch. The rooms were clean though the maid service seem to slide downhill as more people crowded in for the weekend. The breakfast is great during the week, especially the waffle makers. On the weekend, many teenagers on ball teams piled into the hotel so everything changed (no fault of the hotel). My one suggestion would be to use a staff member to man the four waffle irons on days when teenagers are running all over the place. The kids were making quite a mess which made the whole breakfast area unattractive for the other customers. I would definitely stay here again during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Chandler-AzTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Hotel circle. It's clean & comfortable, great value for the rooms. Close to Old Town (about a 7 minute drive) for great food. Close to SeaWorld (about a 12 minute drive). This hotel's free morning breakfast consist of waffles, pastries, cereal, breads, juice and coffee. We have stayed at this hotel in the past and will do so again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: MaryChristmas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Diego - I love this place! spent 9 nights in the Comfort inn (Zoo Seaworld area) honestly - you cannot fault this hotel for cleanliness, the rooms are spacious and nicely refurbished, pool area very good, staff very helpful and friendly - breakfast good! only fault was when busy times the breakfast area gets very busy - could do with a breakfast room each end of the corridoor instead of one room for busy periods like Labor day weekend etc. but we had a fabulous time I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone - families, couples needing a base to explore the fantastic San Diego area. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay; not the best - not the worst. Good for family with young kids”
Reviews.Author: ykbuffalo
Reviews.Content: There is the annoying fee for parking; why they don't just up the rate is beyond me - I hate 'nickle and diming'. But it is on their website and not hidden, so you know it is there if you book through that medium. The room itself was very clean - very important. The pool area was clean as well and well taken care of. Lots of kids - but that is what the pool is for. The breakfast area was again; clean and well taken care of. It was very busy and often difficult to find sitting space during breakfast - however at no time did I see it run out of any of the food duing our 3-nite stay. The location is good and it is close to both food and services. My only critique is that the front desk staff seemed to not be interested in helping and quick to hand a brochure instead of giving proper information or advice. We were given the wrong time for Sea World and were there an hour before it opened. We were given incorrect pricing for the park as well and advised that tickets were the same price at the gate as we could get at the hotel (later found out was not the case). In hindsight it seemed like the clerk just didn't want to be bothered with the work of selling us the tickets. But - I will take the hit as I should have not relied on others and done my own research in this area. Oh, one other complaint is that I did try to do some research, but could not access the internet from my room. And did not want to pay for the computer in the lobby. However these aside, the location and cleanliness made up for it. Would maybe stay again - but most likely would look around for another option.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: susi792
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the kids suite and it worked out really well for our family. THe kids enjoyed having their own space and TV- we enjoyed the space as well. The room was clean and nice -looking. The rooms were cleaned daily and they restocked the towels and supplies. THe air conditioner, refrigerator. TV and micro were all relatively new and in great working condition. The only drawback was the charge for parking which was tight, However, we always found a spot without difficulty, Also, the hotel is right across from the freeway and it can be loud, but we found it soothing!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families - ONLY”
Reviews.Author: wine queen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel due to its proximity to Mission Bay where we were attending a wedding. For this, location was fine, we had a car, hotel was fine as were staff. Our only issue was that it was OVERRUN by families and children. Breakfast was like my worst nightmare. It was more like a zoo with children running over you and in every direction, like they had never been parented in their lives! Probably because it is close to SeaWorld, all the families stay here. For my husband and I, hoping for a bit of peace and quiet it was the absolute opposite. We ended up going out and paying for breakfast because we just couldn't stand that environment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service trumps the not-so-handy location”
Reviews.Author: MrMissy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a kids suite which we found to be more than adequate. It was quite roomy and well thought out. The sink is outside of the bathroom & section off the bedroom area which makes it quite handy but could be noisy if someone is asleep already. Our room overlooked the pool which we didn't use but many people seemed to enjoy. The first night I had to turn on the air con in the bunk room because it got a bit stifling but the next night an open window sufficed and the noise was fine. The location of the hotel isn't handy. You need a car to get ANYTHING or ANYWHERE. Seaworld and the Zoo are still driving distances away and you can't step out to buy a coffee or milk or food. You must have a car. The complimentary breakfast is fine but the layout of the room leads to mealtimes being mayhem. I don't know why but it just seemed so hectic there that we skipped and went elsewhere. Many places have comp breakfasts but it isn't such a bun-fight to get a table or food. The worst thing about the hotel is the paper thin walls & floors. Our next door neighbour had an issue with my kids saying good night to our friends at 10pm after coming back from dinner. It took all over 1 min but I guess he was tired because he yelled at us and then complained that the kids were running around when they weren't. The best thing about the hotel is the front desk staff who dealt with the problem immediately. We had to change hotels due to the unfortunate incident with the other guest but we would have stayed otherwise. The staff are professional, helpful and go out of their way to ensure you have a good stay. Free wifi is also one of the fastest for a hotel. We would not stay here again because we like to be walking distance to a few shops at least but we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others. It's a good value hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “great except the parking”
Reviews.Author: 5contenttravelers
Reviews.Content: There are only two things to complain about. One, there was a chemically clean smell that assaulted us every time we walked in the door. We got used to it quickly, but I worried about whether it was healthy to be breathing that in. Our biggest complain though, is that the parking spaces are so small. Even after the convention which caused the parking garage to overflow, parking was a difficult experience. And they charged $5 per night for this! However, we liked the place when we were not parking or just entering our room. Quick service, comfy bed, very clean, good fridge and microwave, good storage (cabinet and lots of drawers), and a pretty good free breakfast that even includes hardboiled eggs... and we appreciated the bunk beds for the kids. We did wish for a table in the room but the desk sufficed. We also had trouble connecting to the free wireless internet two out of the four times we tried. The freeway and an on ramp is right next to the hotel, and Old Town with lots of restaurants is nearby. We enjoyed take out from The Old Town Mexican Cafe. (But Su Casa in Pacific Beach is even better!) There's also a steak house next door, but we didn't get around to trying it. The pool was average -- 3 feet to 6 feet -- but the kids enjoyed it; and there's a hot tub too. I would consider staying here again, although there are so many hotels in San Diego to choose from I bet we'll try someplace else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called "UNCOMFORTABLE INN"!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: michpad1234
Reviews.Content: I did alot of searching and read alot of reviews before I picked this place. Don't let the pictures decieve you. Don't stay here! We stayed in a family bunk bed suite. It was HOT and Dark and very Noisey by the freeway! Couldn't open our window. The air flow where the queen bed was is TERRIBLE! The airconditioner is very old! We wanted to check out early! The bed is extrememly uncomfortable as well as pillows but what I want to stress is the airflow and darkness of the room. Very closterphobic! The buffet was very over crowed and waffle batter was not good. Coffee was empty and there was no one to refill or clean tables. If you wait to late they run out of food! Would never recommend this place, please continue on and book else where. Staff were not very friendly or compassionate at all. Couldn't wait till we checked out and moved on!

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel, but overpriced and they charged for parking!”
Reviews.Author: Ciociia_Mom
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nicely decorated and for the most part they were clean. The front desk staff was friendly, polite and helpful. We like that. But I was informed at the desk that we had to pay $4.95 for a permit to park in their lot. What the heck! I can see requiring people to display the permit, to show we are actually hotel guests, but why charge us for it? We stayed in eight different hotels during our vacation and this is the only one that charged us. If nothing else, parking should have been free for Choice Privileges members like us. The room was one of the more expensive on our trip, totaling almost $150 with taxes. That's a bit steep. My family really enjoyed the pool. And the complimentary breakfast was one of the nicer ones we've enjoyed. It is VERY busy in the breakfast room, so the staff needs to do a better job of wiping tables between families. There were five of us in the room and they gave us ONLY TWO TOWELS and only two washcloths. Not even a hand towel to keep near the sink. Why so skimpy with the towels? I called and requested three more towels and three washcloths. They brought the towels and a few extras, but no washcloths and I had to contact them again. Frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: jenlyn5
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms. Bathroom sink however is right in the room at the end of one of the beds. Makes it difficult for one person to use while others may be sleeping. Breakfast area is much too small and they ran out of items. Room was supposed to be newly renovated but didn't look like it to us. Pool was nice and heated. You still have to drive to any attractions, so don't think you are extremely close to Sea World or the Zoo. SW was still about a 5-10 minute drive and the Zoo about 10-15 minutes. Parking lot is extremely small - even for cars to get in and out of. You have an inch or two between cars in spaces and have to do a 15-point turn in order to back in and out of the spaces. The attached garage has a little more space. Has one elevator - which is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Was an okay stay but went downhill.”
Reviews.Author: 4forme
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to visit our son and his wife, who are stationed in the area. We planned to stay 7 nights but checked out 2 days early. Overall the room was fine, and the check in process went well. The area was clean inside and out. The breakfast was a variety of fruits, bagels, muffins, boiled eggs and cereal, along with make your own waffles. We didn't utilize the pool, as the temperature was a bit chilly for our liking, but it looked inviting, and other guests seemed to enjoy it. The parking was an additional fee, and the last couple of nights it was impossible to find a spot, as several vehicles were taking up 2 spaces. I doubt they paid double, and since we were paying as well, the management should have requested they move to allow other guests to park. We other guests arriving had the same problem and had to park on the street. The last night we stayed, we arrived back to find housekeeping had left us no towels or washcloths in the room. My daughters and husband were in the breakfast room the last morning of our stay and our youngest dropped her muffin on the floor as she tried to manuver through the breakfast area. The staff had begun to put up some breakfast items and refused to let her have a replacement, though they were on the table. We brought up these issues to the front desk, but nothing was done, with exception of getting 3 towels brought up 45 minutes after calling down to ask for them. I really disliked having to use my credit card at $5 for 10 min. to use a pc downstairs when I had my laptop, just because I needed to print out a copy of tickets we purchased. We plan to return to the area in the late fall, but without assurance the problems would not arise again, I doubt we would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, not so nice area...”
Reviews.Author: Hapagal
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here with our 2 year old after a day trip to the SD Zoo. This was located in the Hotel Circle area, which is conveniently located to the freeway & airport, but I would not stay in this area next time. The area was a bit rundown and you have to pay a parking fee of $4.95/day. This hotel was newly renovated and the rooms were nice and clean, but the pool area faced the parking lot--not very nice. If you mind the buzz of the freeway, make sure you request a room that doesn't overlook it (ours did). Also, if you plan on ordering pizza from one of the menus that the room offers, stay away from Verona's Pizza. The food was not good at all (we took a bite and couldn't eat the rest, we are not that picky). When I called them back to let them know we were not satisfied, the so called mgr told me they don't give cash back and that I could call the owner the next day and hung up on me. The next morning we went to the breakfast area to enjoy the complimentary breakfast. This was a chaotic mess. We got there around 8ish and it was very crowded. There was cereal, little pastries/muffins, boiled eggs, bagels/toast, coffee/juices, some fruit and the dreadful do-it-yourself waffle station. There was a long line, and the waffle station was a bit dirty from all of the spilled batter. I think it would be better if they had an employee in charge of the waffle making. At least have someone to oversee all of these hungry guests trying to make their own waffles. Also, the tables were not cleared or cleaned. I saw 2 ladies refill the cereal machine, but no one cleaning up after the guests. Finally. there were non-quests enjoyonh the free breakfast as well--we overheard a group saying they live nearby and were coming back the next day to take advantage of the free food. Again, there wasn't an employee maintaing the breakfast area. The crowd and the uncleanliness ruined the whole breakfast experience. (We usually enjoy the same type of breakfast at the Holiday Inn Express in Cardiff) So we decided to skip the pool and check out early. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value...Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TomL911
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, reasonable price. The Kids' Suite was a good choice! Kids loved having a separate "room" with bunk beds and their own TV. Staff courteous and friendly. Complimentary breakfast just ok...Best part was making waffles. Pool was very clean and never crowded. Parking tight if driving anything bigger than a mid-sized sedan. It's a shame they charge $4.95 daily for parking...kinda cuts into the overall value. Location of hotel was literally minutes from all our destinations. Recommended, but remember its a no frills hotel, though clean, comfortable, and a good value for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Good but can use a little work”
Reviews.Author: Millyj
Reviews.Content: (I'm an avid TA reviewer as you can see from my monogrammed Trip Advisor hat in my profile pic) I just came back on yesterday from a one night stay and although the hotel is in a great location (we visited the Zoo) it could still use a little work. When I made my reservation online I requested an early check-in but according to the front desk clerk when we arrived (around 12 noon or so) the rooms were all booked so we had to wait until 3pm check in which was fine BUT I requested a crib for my 9 month old and that wasn't brought to our attention being that she could read our notes on the reservation when we came in. In my personal opinion the desk clerk could have a been a bit nicer or at least learn how to speak to customers in a way that would not make one feel unwelcomed or uncomfortable. I believe she wasn't warm with my husband or myself. ( I understand people have bad days at work, but when you're working with the public you have to learn how to set aside your personal troubles) We had our 15yr old w/us so the beds were big enough for all 4 of us. In my opinion its more a family type of stop and go hotel being that the Zoo and SeaWorld are nearby - so lots of children are to be expected...not a really quiet hotel. The hotel itself is clean and the rooms are decent and clean, the pool area is small and closes at 10pm. There is a breakfast room on the 4th floor - the continental buffet closes at 9am - my husband and I got there at about 8:15 so it wasn't bad but as soon as it's close to 9am watch out - there was a swarm of people trying to get there at the last minute which made for uncomfortable maneuvering. The thing I liked was that you had to have a hotel key to get into the elevator from the parking garage (which by the way is 4.95 a day to park) so not just anyone could come into the hotel. If you wanted a late check-out it would be $30 more up to 4pm. Our overall stay was not bad, but the parking could use work as well as the warmness of the front desk clerk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Shanz813
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 3 nights on our vacation to go to the zoo and sea world. We were so close to both of these attractions and the airport that it was a dream location for us, as we have 2 little kids and had to navigate naps and getting to and from quickly. The rooms were very clean and we had a kids suite.....it was basically a queen room renovated to throw a wall up to separate the king bed from the bunk bed area....it worked well for our purposes of separating out our baby and toddler....very clean and the service was very quick when we needed additional towels, pillows, etc...the hotel was recently renovated as mentioned in other reviews....also, there are 2 comfort suites on the hotel circle so I would be sure which one you are staying at. You are able to buy zoo and sea world tickets at the hotel, which I would recommend as to not have to stand in lines when you get there. My only complaint is that you have to pay for parking which I thought should be included in a hotel stay. Overall, great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Joe44Calgary
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here in April when we visited Seaworld. We had a great time, the hotel and room were both very good. The room was spotless and the pool was very clean and warm for the kids. I would however make sure that when you book you insist on a room facing the pool and not the freeway! We were facing the pool and is was very quiet but I can imagine that if you are facing the freeway it would be very loud as the hotel really couldn't be any closer to the road than it is. Breakfast was nice, even had waffles. Overall a great stay with our family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Claucat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Diego Comfort Inn and Suites Zoo/ SeaWorld for one night after reading the positive reviews on this site. I am extremelly picky and was very happy with our choice. The rooms had been recently renovated and were well appointed with a very comfy bed, a large bathroom and a flat screen TV. The free wireless internet was a big plus as was the complementary breakfast. I have stayed in San Diego many times in more expensive hotels and found this one to be exactly what I was looking for and a real good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Loved the kids suite...”
Reviews.Author: murraycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights on a family vacation and loved it. Great location and easy to get to everything. We had a kid's suite with the bunk beds and the room was great. The kids loved having their own space (and t.v.!) Rooms were nice and clean. Staff was very friendly. It was a bit chilly for the pool (even though it was heated), but the kids did get in. Laundry facilities were a nice addition, though they did get busy at night. Breakfast buffet was great. It does get busy in there but we never had a problem finding a table. All in all a great hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: ProPoke
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego expecting to stay at the Town & Country Resort but had to change plans after they didn't honor the reservations we booked weeks in advance. We thankfully had an AAA California book with us so we called Comfort Inn to see if they had a room with 2 beds at a reasonable price. At $89.00 a day and a parking charge of $4.95 a day, we decided to give it a chance. When we arrived, we found the parking spots were real tight. In the second enterance/exit, there is a spot by a light pole which is by the street that is wider than the other spots so we parked there. Check in was fast and when we got to our room, we were happy to see a very large room with two queen beds. The TV was an LG flat screen, probably a 37 inch model. The heater was quiet for a window unit. The mattresses were comfortable. There was a very small refigerator in the room which came in handy. The bathroom wasn't large but was adequate as the sink is outside the shower/toliet area. There is a heated pool outside with a hot tub by the pool. All in all, very pleased with the room. There was only a couple of negatives. The breakfast room is on the 4th floor and this room gets really crowded with people. There is one waffle maker and there was a huge line of people waiting for it. They were out of toast and bagels. They had various kinds of muffins and boiled eggs. No hot foods like eggs were served. The employees were just overwhelmed with the amount of people in the breakfast area. There was a lot noise in our room. We were on the third floor and I could not tell if the noise was from people walking above us or if it was coming from the hallway or maybe from rooms beside us. There just seemed to be more noise than usual. Like I said earlier, the parking spots are really tight and you have to watch for the pillars, other cars, ect. All in all though, we were pretty happy with the stay. We wouldn't have a problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovation, scary location”
Reviews.Author: queenV2
Reviews.Content: I booked my family members at the comfort inn zoo/sea world area because of the pictures that I saw online and its location. The location is great...close to downtown, close to sea world, close to balboa park, close to old town, and freeway close. However, the path upon exiting the freeway and driving up to the hotel was scary! It was a dark street and had a bunch of trucks parked along the side of the street and the street was full of trash. Other than that, the staff was very nice and the room was nicely renovated. The only weird thing was the sink was outside of the bathroom. So it was strange having to exit the bathroom and wash your hands in front of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Stay”
Reviews.Author: okirk99
Reviews.Content: The employees were friendly and helpful, and the kids suite was nice and clean, but we were unhappy about a few things. The internet did not work in our room, and the bunk beds were very, very hard. The king bed was on the firm side also. And the breakfast area was very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “I recomend it”
Reviews.Author: sorias
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, clean and really good breakfast. Very family friendly and the staff was very nice and friendly. This was the first time we went to San Diego and was extreamly helpfull the driving directions they provide at the front desk to all the fun places nearby. I will totally recomend this hotel for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We had an ok stay”
Reviews.Author: momof4inaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in the kids suite. When we arrived at 9pm I asked if we could extend our stay a night. The front desk said they had plenty of rooms, but that I should the main reservation line in the morning as they could give me the best rate. She said the bunk bed suite would cost $139 a night. I called the next morning at 8am and the reservationist said that they didn't have any rooms available. I explained what I had been told the night before and she called the front desk for me. She asked me to go downstairs and make the reservation with them directly. When I got downstairs I was told that they had limited rooms and that it would $169. I explained that they would not take my reservation the night before, but said that I would get a better rate in the morning. The manager said there was nothing he could do. So we were off to a bad start for our stay. We liked the room set up, but had ants in the room, gum on the floor and a baby bottle under the bed. (Probably responsible for the ants) The pool was clean and not too crowed and the washing machines were convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: nzkelly
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with this hotel. We spent 3 nights in one of the kids suites. It was recently renovated and the room was clean and tidy. Beds were very comfortable, and it was nice having a tv for the kids as well as one for the adults. The complimentary breakfast was very good, it did tend to get very busy though, but there was plenty of food, and the breakfast room was clean. All the staff were courteous and helpful. There was no extra charge for a crib for our baby which was a pleasant surprise. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the San Diego area. The location is very convenient to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Bunk Beds, 2 TV's and Privacy”
Reviews.Author: Disneylovers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago, and have seen additional renovations since then. When you have 2 kids who don't want to share a bed, the bunk beds work out well. The kids have their own flat screen TV, and there's a sliding window door to separate their area from the parents' comforable king bed and additional TV. Microwave and mini-fridge are tucked away behind the bathroom sink area; hotel furniture and fixtures are updated. The hotel has easy access to Highway 8 and getting into Old Town, Sea World, and shopping centers. Yes, there's a continental breakfast with lots of families and can be crowded, but the staff re-stock and clean quickly. There will always be problems, but again, the staff has alway been very accommodating to us. If you don't want to deal with minor inconveniences, spend the extra money on another hotel property; we'd rather use the money on the vacation activities instead.

Reviews.Title: “UnComfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: MonocleTraveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel Circle South property was one of the worst hotel experiences ever! Room the size of a hampster cage - bruised myself walking inbetween the bed and dresser. Need to run AC 24/7 just to keep the room comfortable. Walls paper-thin - don't plan on sleeping in on the weekend. "Deluxe Breakfast Buffet" is what the marquee advertised - reminded me of a cattle feed lot. Not enough seating to accomodate guests, dirty, crowded, noisy. Breakfast consisted of a menu of carbs, boiled eggs (mine had a hair on it), and the line to get coffee was six deep! Fresh fruit consisted of apples and bruised oranges - no seasonal fruit. Not enough parking for everyone. They refill the shampoo bottles every day - no conditioner. Pool towels the size of large hand towels - took a stack to get dried off. The ice machine was locked behind the pool gate after 10 pm, so no ice for that late night cocktail. The bed was comfortable and our room was clean - if you want to really enjoy your stay in San Diego, spend a few more dollars and stay at a Marriott's!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Candella
Reviews.Content: Really good selection for the price. We stayed here for a couple of week nights in late August for a trip with our preschooler to visit various places in San Diego. A month before, we had stayed at the Comfort Inn right across the freeway and I have to say I was more impressed with this Comfort Inn "Sea World/Zoo". The renovation was obvious on the second floor where we stayed, it didn't have that smoked-in, non-smoking room odor that the Comfort Inn rooms had across the street. This is after all supposed to be a non-smoking property. The room was quite spacious. Ours was laid out like a big square rather than a long rectangle. The decor was fresh, clean and modern. The room was very clean and the air conditioning was great, no problems as other have stated. I was kind of worried about these things before I booked based on reviews, but took a chance and I'm so glad I did. I just really appreciated the simple design, and clean room - especially the clean carpet. That's a big deal to me since we stayed somewhere else on the weekend and I found out how spoiled we were when our socks turned black at the other place! We asked for a quiet room and we were given one. We clogged the toilet right when we got in (not the hotel's fault) which they quickly fixed. Bathroom light was too dim though. And the tv was fuzzy, though we fixed that by propping some of the cables up in back of the television. Pool was a modest size and warm and my child had a great time there. Parking was fine until later in the evening when it became clear how terrible the situation was. Simply no parking left except the dark side street. I circled the lot a dozen times for something to turn up and luckily it did for my van. You might have better luck with a compact car, but even then, everyone parks badly simply because the spaces are too tight and there's hardly enough room in the lanes. I'd say this is the major drawback to this hotel. Also, there shouldn't be a problem finding the location if you map it. Though it's not in plain sight, it's right off the freeway, conveniently next to the AAA and the Hunter Steakhouse next door to it has top-rate, delectable Prime Rib if you can afford it. This hotel, like the others of hotel circle, are in a great location. Pop right on the freeway and get to anywhere quickly - Sea World/Mission Bay, Old Town, Downtown, Hillcrest, Balboa Park, etc. The free breakfast was one of the great things about Comfort Inn. I showed up at 6 am to get some stuff to bring back to my room for my family before the crowd hit. Waffle mix wasn't ready, nor were some other items out until later, but it wasn't a big deal, just came back later to get them, though it was a crazy in there around 9. If you want some peace, just get in there early or bring it back to your room, no big deal. Overall, it was a great experience and we intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WiseonePalmSprings
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable hotel. Breakfast great value. Rooms just renovated very nice with refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Hot-Pick someplace else !!”
Reviews.Author: janeblaize
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? This place is god awfull- This Hotel needs a GOOD CLEANING and REPAIR ! I was afraid to touch anything due to the grime and dirt on all the facilities. The elevator and the soda machine were broken- I couldn't find any parking -so what if its free? The eating room was packed with screaming kids and cereal all over the floor- I think they have bed bugs as well. Go up the street to the Motel 6-Its cheaper and cleaner. The hotel is one of the worst places I've ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GMullins
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn with my sister, parents, and 4 year old niece. The outside of the hotel is going under some renovation, but the inside is complete and is just like brand new. The room was large, as well as the bathroom. The air conditioning worked well, and house keeping did a great job. Breakfast was included in the room rate, and was your basic continental hotel breakfast with a make your own waffle station. This is an excellent hotel choice when staying as a group. It is in a perfect location between the zoo and sea world. If you are looking for a weekend getaway, do not hesitate to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations still going on”
Reviews.Author: EventDiva
Reviews.Content: Like the last 2 posters, we stayed at this hotel in June and ran into many of the same problems. The A/C issue is totally unacceptable, the pull out sofa was in that room... so my kids slept in that one. Unfortunately their room was an ice box and ours was hot because the unit in the other room wasnt "working yet." We also ran into power outages (one for 3 hours during nap time for the kids) so hubby and I had no TV, no lights, etc. in the other room. I will say that the newly renovated rooms are very nice, everything is brand new. Once all of the kinks are worked out, this will be a good property for the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: jsandersnaz
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel ever! The website states they are newly renovated which is a lie they are still renovating!!! The power was shut off twice while we were there. Once for 3 hrs and a second time for an hour. They shut the power off another day for an hour. The pool was under constructions, they took out their video game room which they had advertised on their website. The morning breakfast was like a feeding frenzy no room to get in or out. The newly remodel rooms were seperated by french doors and only had one air conditioning unit so one room was freezing the other hot as hell. The staff were unfriendly and not helpful, nor was the gerneral manager. After all the problems we had the hotel we weren't even compensate for all these horrible problems!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be cautious!!”
Reviews.Author: 3badkitties
Reviews.Content: I saw this hotel online, was pleased with the online description and decided to book it for a weeks stay. The hotel is undergoing renovations. I was not warned of this when I booked, and I did use there 1 - 800 number. Due to the renovations, parking is a nightmare. There were multiple trash dumpsters and trash bags in the parking lot which took up a good chunk of parking spaces. Due to the resurfacing of the pool, they did not want you to park in front of the pool to allow for the work trucks to have access. This made parking non existent. The first night I stayed out late, and it literally took about 30minutes to find a place to park. There was a distinctly unpleasant smell to the room. It was made tolerable by keeping the fan on at all times. The odor especially bothered my daughter who is sensitive to smells. My remote control for the tv didn't work. I called to the front desk to ask for a replacement one, and no one ever came with one. After an hour, I went down to the front desk to change it out myself. I was told "Oh yeah." The next night, after room service cleaned my room, I was given no hand towels or wash cloths. It took over 45 minutes for a rude security guard to come bring a handful of washcloths. The next night, we were not given any hand towels. After my prior experiences, I did not try to get them. There is a breakfast buffet. While I'm sure most of the food was alright, I could not get past the noticable moldy oranges that were put out for guest consumption. I found the employees to be generally rude and unfriendly. A smile or a thank you for coming would have done wonders for me. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is less than 10 minutes away from the airport, zoo, and Sea World. While I would be cautious at best about staying here, I'm sure it will be somewhat more tolerable once the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place to stay in San diego”
Reviews.Author: neguas98
Reviews.Content: The photos are very deceiving. They can use the excuse about being in the process of renovation. But that is a lie. The hotel stinks like garbage & urine. I advised the front desk several times that there was dry "poop" smeared on the wall & elevator.. We were there for 3 days and they never cleaned it off. i have photos and have written several times to the corporate office with neg results. I was unable to find another hotel and i promised my kid sea world. so we stood as little time as possible at the hotel. The tv was very old and blury (thank God we took are own DVD player) & the a/c never worked. I can go on and on but I thing u got the idea. If u hate your family then take them here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Under construction”
Reviews.Author: Nightingale252
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel would have been much nicer if we'd stayed after construction was finished, but parts of the hotel were closed off (making it difficult to get around the building at times), there was dust and noise, they shut off the water during the day, and the fitness room was just a dusty empty room covered in plaster. We were not aware the building was under renovations. The pool and jacuzzi area would have been very nice (large, deep pool, and big hot tub, towels provided, resort-style) except the pool really needed cleaning. If you got any of the water in your mouth it just tasted like pee, and not sanitary at all. We had trouble getting the proper rooms. Our windows didn't open, although my parents across the hall could open theirs. We had a fridge and they did not. Internet was slow. I would only consider staying there again if I knew the construction were complete and that they had cleaned to pool.

Reviews.Title: “Overall I have no really big complaints.”
Reviews.Author: mmnby
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 1 night just to be able to go to Sea World the next day. We had late check in and found parking very easily. We were told at check in that they were currently doing construction and was given a map and shown how to get the the continental breakfast as well as our room. We had a 2 queen bed room and found it fine for our needs. The beds were comfy and the room was spacious and clean. We were located across from a elevator and the freeway but found it not very noisy at all. The free internet was nice, the pop machine on our floor did not work so we had to go the lobby. The Laundry room was also nice. In the morning we did go tot the breakfast as we were trying to save a few bucks. We had to go back to reception as the map we were given wasn't clear engouh and we couldn't find the food! Very long line, we were in it for about 15 mins, counting the time to get our food. Seating was hard to find and we were just about to take out food to our room when we found a spot. Overall I have no really big complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: vickiusa
Reviews.Content: My husband booked reservation at the Comfort Inn located at Hotel Circle Pl in San Diego for 1-31 and 2-1. We were told by the reservation person that they would provide free of charge transfer from the Airport. Wrong! We were put in a van "Cloud 9" with 5 other passangers and charged something like $12 per person. We didn't get the name of the person that told him this therefore nothing could be done regarding the charge for the "Free Transfer service". We got to our room, which was a handicap room that was not necessary. My husband turned on the TV and nothing but snow. The room smelled musty so I proceeded to slide the window when a portion of the frame came off in my hand. I went to use the restroom, flushed the toilet and water poured out of the ceiling over the sink that was located in the bedroom. There was a light fixture in the ceiling in that area and I was afraid of an electrical fire. We called the front desk and was told by the clerk that she would have an "engineer" come check out the problems. The "engineer walked in, saw the water coming from the ceiling and said "You need to get another room". We loaded up our luggage and went to the front desk. We were told the place was full but she could check with the hotel across the street. To make a long story short, we couldn't find another hotel and after 2 hrs. of trying, the clerk gave us another room she was holding for a late arrival guest. This room wasn't a lot better but at least water wasn't pouring from the ceiling. Signs were posted throughout the building that the building contained chemicals that were hazardous to your health. Not a good experience! Besides the problems with the hotel, getting around from this area was very expensive. For a taxi ride to the Airport or the Pier area was $25 one way. It would of been better to stay in the Gaslight District or the Pier area. You can catch the trolley in both of those areas and a day pass was only $5 per person and get around to most of the tourist areas in the city.

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: traveler4k
Reviews.Content: I received a great deal on priceline and was given a corner handicapped room. The room was large, but the beds were uncomfortable and the facility was shaggy at best. I just used it to sleep so no big deal. If I were to stay longer, I would certiainly not have considered this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and clean rooms for a modest price.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Tate
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean room for a reasonable price, but the price comes with some noisy kids running and yelling in the halls in the early morning hours. Rooms: We had a "Kids Room" that had one king-sized bed and a bunk-bed that was big enough for a six-foot-tall 16 year-old boy. The shower was newly tiled and had adequate water pressure but the water temperature fluctuated quite a bit while showering. The A/C unit seemed a little old and I had to get up several times to get it to work but it worked well when it was on. A mini-fridge and other standard room amenities (iron, coffer maker, etc.) also came with the room. Amenities: There's a great little breakfast area where guests can choose from coffee, tea, juice, toast, muffins, pastries, hard-boiled eggs, cold cereal, oatmeal, apples, and do-it-yourself Belgium wafflesâ€“all for free! The hotel provides free USA Today newspapers in the lobby and a machine outside to purchase copies of the San Diego Union Tribune. A large, heated swimming pool and spa are both open very late. There's plenty of parking: We never had a hard time finding a space, even on sold-out nights. On the lobby floor, there's a small arcade room where kids can play games. Customer Service: The front desk staff all seemed to be very helpful and friendly. The one occasion where I interacted with a housekeeper was pleasant. The attendant in the complimentary breakfast area was a busy girl (Be sure to put a dollar in her jar!). Location: The hotel is a little tricky to get to from Hwy 8. Just remember: The hotel is NORTH of Hwy 8 (hence "Hotel Circle North"). There are two shopping malls within a five-minute drive (Fashion Valley and Mission Valley). The Gaslamp District, Horton Plaza, The SD Zoo, Balboa Park, and Sea World are all within 10-15 minutes. The Wild Animal Park is about 25 minutes away. Hint: If you are planning to visit the Zoo and Wild Animal Park, it will be cheaper to purchase an annual membership to the Zoological Society of San Diego (Google it for more info). Overall: I wouldn't recommend this property to a newlywed couple looking for a quiet, romantic stay, but if you're traveling with kids, then it'll work nicely and save you some money at breakfast time. Hope this helps. Kevin Tate Modesto, CA

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Kids!!”
Reviews.Author: natedogWestJordan
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn & Suites Zoo was close to the freeway and a close drive to Sea World. The staff was friendly upon check in but we were a little aggravated after waiting in line nearly 10 min as there was only one person at the front desk. We stayed in a kids suite with the bunk beds which was fun however, for some reason, you have to put the sheets on the bed yourself which we found in a drawer below. Although others have complained about the breakfast, we found the breakfast bar fully stocked with food and easily found a place to sit. They had a full time staff member at the breakfast area ensuring that the food was not running out and the tables were wiped off. I had been warned by other reviewers about the food brochures that get put under the door and upon check in, we found two or three under our door. I guess this is becoming an issue at the hotel as our hotel room had a specific sign informing us not to order food from the companies who illegally slip in the brochers. The only complaint I would have about the hotel was the carpet that was stretched out had many waves and humps which I found myself tripping over at times. I thought this was maybe just my room but found the carpet to be the same in other rooms as we walked down the hall an could see the maids cleaning the rooms. The last item would be that you have to use your room key to access the elevator in the parking garage. This was a nice security feature except that we found that our key only worked about the half the time on the elevator. This became a little comical as we would ask others in the parking lot if their key worked better than ours. We found that others had this same problem and were grateful that it wasn't just us. Overall, we were pleased with the Hotel and would most likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Canadians' pleasant stay Oct 6-9/07”
Reviews.Author: MzPiggy66
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, but there were a few things that might need to be addressed. The hotel itself is large and near the freeway but we found that to be positive. We were really glad we rented a car. You definitely need one here. You can't walk anywhere. Our family of 5 stayed in a suite and were given the largest room. It however smelt like old smoke, even though it was a non smoking room. It was right by the elevator but for the most part didn't bother us. Everyone in the hotel seemed to get up at 7ish anyway. The free breakfast was a bonus, we enjoyed that. The lineup was way too long, esp. around 9. The parking spaces were quite tight and when you have a rental, that is a concern. The front staff were exceptionally pleasant. We were able to check into our room at 10 because our travel agent arranged that for us. We ordered pizza to our room as well. The front desk told us of a great pizza place and NOT to use the flyers that are slipped under your door. Pool was too small and cold. If you are new to San Diego, get a GPS with your rental, it will save you a lot of grief!

Reviews.Title: “Not such a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TorranceRyan
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights at this Comfort Inn expecting a decent place since it received 3 diamonds from AAA. When my family and I checked into the room, we were very disappointed. The bath tub and tile had mold on them and the stairs from the parking garage smelled like urine. Our room was also about 50 feet from the freeway, which was pretty noisy. We ended up moving to another hotel after the first night. On the positive side, the free breakfast was nice, although crowded and you do get free high speed internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great and inexpensive for a group of 6”
Reviews.Author: king710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn & Suites Zoo/Sea World Area August 12-17. We had 6 people in our group so we had a 2 bedroom suite (2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper). It worked great for us. We are not picky people and we don't need a 5 star hotel, but if you are one of these people - this place isn't for you. The room was a little smaller than I had hoped but we managed. The vanity is on the outside of the bathroom which was nice. The room also had a microwave and a small refrigerator. We weren't right next to the interstate so it wasn't noisy - although we could hear people upstairs, but it sounded like they were jumping. The breakfast was nice but had to get there early otherwise you stood in a line. The service was good and we got what we needed when we needed it. The only problem we had was our keys were deactivated on Wednesday and we needed them through Friday and there was a bit of a line to reactivate them - but it was solved. We didn't eat at the steakhouse next door because we had heard it was expensive. There is no other eating establishment close, but access to the interstate was easy. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: jjmcd97
Reviews.Content: Arrived yesterday for a week's stay. I would already be searching for a suitable replacement if I thought I might find one last minute. The hotel is literally adjacent to Hwy. 8 and the kids' room windows face the freeway (lots of overnight motorcycles and trucks made for a fitful night's sleep). Thin walls/doors made for lots of late-night noise in the hallways as well. Room is much smaller than the pictures make it seem and everything is very outdated.
