The pool is dirty - both on the bottom (sand, dirt, etc.) and the top (dead bugs galore!) and right next to the parking lot. Pool water is on the cold side, but not so cold that the kids wouldn't use it (the chlorine level is off the charts, which is good and bad...no bacteria could survive in there but all that chlorine isn't good either). Hot tub is more of a "warm" tub and has the same floating debris that makes the pool desirable only if you're a kid. Just did the free breakfast, which was decent but poorly laid out and very crowded, only the former of which I would fault the hotel for. Proximity to area attractions is about the only plus here. It is otherwise a pretty gross place to stay. For what you get, it is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “yes, this place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: Ahnold
Reviews.Content: This place needs an overhaul badly. The only thing positive to say is that it's close to Sea World. Otherwise, it's basically a dump. Wallpaper is peeling. Beds, sheets, and bedspreads old and nasty. The vent fan in the bathroom made lots of noise but didn't move any air, even after maintenance "fixed" it. So, the bathroom was always damp, humid, and smelly. We had a kids suite, with two separate rooms that could be closed off. A wall fan was installed to move air between the rooms, but the knob was missing, so it didn't work. Televisions are very old, easily over 10 years (not kidding). Remote controls were sticky, one didn't work. Air conditioning / heating unit is located under the window in the kids room. VERY NOISY from the vibrating plastic covers. The continental breakfast is OK, but very poorly organized. So, if you show up at 8AM, expect to stand in a long line, especially if you want toast or a waffle. Coffee was horrible. The swimming pool was OK, but it's right next to the parking lot. Noisy and very unappealing unless you're a kid. For over $200 per night, I hoped for more. We are never going back...

Reviews.Title: “Some hits, some misses”
Reviews.Author: imso808
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at this hotel, and overall, it was a hit & miss experience. Room was visibly clean, but carpets were dirty. Bed was very comfortable, but pillows were so small. Hotel staff were helpful but not very friendly. It was very loud, but there seemed to be some sports teams staying there at the same time we were. Breakfast was good but very crowded (GO EARLY). Free, freshly brewed coffee 24 hours a day. Free parking but rather tight. Near to all the major attractions, airport, mall, restaurants, freeways, but neighborhood is a little dark. I'd consider staying here again the next time I'm in San Diego. Hopefully the carpets will get cleaned or changed by that time.

Reviews.Title: “Might stay again”
Reviews.Author: crwinter1
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a kid suite. Our kids had their own room with bunkbeds. The size of the room was adequate for a family of four. The desk clerks were professional and nice. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom clean. The worst part about the room was dirty carpets. Our crawling baby got very dirty on his hands and knees as did our socks. This grossed us out. The breakfast room was way too small for the size of the hotel. Expect to stand in line to eat anywhere from 15-40 minutes to get your food and there is not nearly enough seating. The food was fine although the coffee was terrible (self serve waffles, breads, cereals, fruit and drinks).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: AZHeat200
Reviews.Content: We (3 adults/1 teen) had 2 rooms (2 queens) on the 4th floor for 2 nights mid week in June 07. This is a nice hotel. They recently upgraded the mattresses, so they are very comfortable. The rooms were clean and roomy. Our rooms faced the freeway on ramp, but was NOT noisey. All of staff were nice. All elevators worked. There is a large selection at the breakfast buffet: muffins, toast, begals, fruit, boiled eggs, juices, coffee, milk, cereals, make your own waffles. And they didn't start picking up exactly at 9:30 when the buffet ended. There is a pricey steakhouse on site (didn't eat there). The wireless internet worked well in the room & in lobby. Is close to attractions and shopping. Parking has good spaces and tight spaces. Late night parking is tight. But from our many trips to San Diego all hotel parking is tight. The only small negative was the 13" TV, but it did work. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and wornout”
Reviews.Author: lt.ripley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, had a coupon but they told us that they couln't accept that because they had more than 80% occupation. Hard to know if that was true. We paid about 100$/night. First room we got smelled smoke, so we asked for a change. That wasn't a problem. The room was spaciuos (we had a 2 bed-room) but worn out. Not a nice bathroom. The breakfast was ok, pretty much to choose from, but the breakfastroom was crowdy. The fitnessroom was a joke. Overall, this was the least price-worthy motel in our threeweek-trip across California. It can't be so hard to find something more pricyworthy.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not great though...”
Reviews.Author: brinaim
Reviews.Content: We saw an ad in one of those traveler's discout coupon books for this place, and decieded to see if they'd honor the rate ($79.) The desk clerk told my wife that the rate was $119, but she'd honor the coupon anyways, so that was a plus. This hotel is laid out weird. The rooms are on the top three floors, and the parking area is the first floor. It pays to park by the lobby and unload there, and then move the car to the elevator closest to your room, otherwise you could carry your stuff quite a ways. The room was huge, and had a fridge and microwave in it, again, another plus. But, the window was broken, and could not close all the way. There were burnt out lights in our room, and the DSL would not work (after complaining to the front desk twice, and having someone come up to look at it.) Our room was on the 2nd floor, and about 5 a.m. the guest in the room above ours was moving about, and it sounded like they were going to fall through the celling. I was able to fall back asleep, and we woke up in time for the free breakfast, which was average, nothing too special though. I liked the proximity to the I-8 freeway, and did not feel threatned by the neighborhood as others have stated. I would have been mad if I had payed $119 for this place, but I can't complain too much since we saved $40 with a coupon.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Chrisaf
Reviews.Content: Location easy to get to/from freeway. Nothing to see/do within walking distance, short drive to Old Town San Diego. Parking included. Check-in desk area cramped, service was okay. Stayed in two different rooms in different wings. Western wing of hotel (closest to pool) clearly older (noisier, mustier, dodgier elevators). Mattress below average. Breakfast was included, but was problematic. The food itself was typical low-end continental, but restocking was slow and the line was busy (and this was the off season). Fruit was badly bruised. Seating space was very limited, and was very dirty and noisy. Only ONE toaster! Pool area was not inviting. The price I paid was less than some others rating the hotel, but still not worth it. Not "Terrible" but give this place a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location for Mission Valley and Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine777
Reviews.Content: We felt this was a good value, at $59 through hotwire.com. The location was very convenient and an easy drive to key locations. The room was clean, extra large, and quiet. The free breakfast was fine, although it was crowded. It was well-stocked with danishes, bagels, toast, boiled eggs, juices, coffee, hot chocolate, cereal and fruit. Unfortunately, some parents allowed their children to be unattended in the hallways and the excercise room (which had old equipment and was small). The staff was cold but efficient. Complimentary toothbrush (I forgot mine) was good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing positive but the location”
Reviews.Author: tigercpa
Reviews.Content: Have never had a problem with Comfort on the East Coast, but this was easily the worst hotel in the chain. I must agree with another reviewer - some of the folks writing these reviews must have stayed at a different hotel. This was dirty, extremely cramped. We had reserved a kids suite, but our "suite" was a regular room with 2 bunk beds crammed in, and no separation, as was advertised. Very poor. Breakfast room was filthy and was nearly out of most foods (not that there was a great selection to begin wth). One family spilled milk and juice on their table, their child vomitted and they simply got up and left without notifying an attendant of the "mess". Parking and elevators were no picnic either. Staff was non-existent and two-thirds of the laundry facilities were out of order. Also - BE WARNED - do not order food from the people who leave flyers under the door. These are not licensed providers, just people cooking out of their homes. They are not supposed to solicit at the hotel. The food will arrive late, and they will demand more than the quoted price. Will not stay at this location ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel in a very SAD neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: kmurph
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, the location is really a distraction from the hotel. Its right off the highway, not in a good way. It is close to Sea World for sure, and the Zoo is about 10 minutes. But you will need to drive for everything as there is only one place to eat within walking distance (which is actually a very nice place for food). If I were to return to the area, I would not stay here. At $175 per night, it is no bargin and the hotel really is bare-bones. The mattresses were hard and sloped, there were no basic mattress pads on the kid's bunk beds (just bottom sheets) and the air conditioning unit was loud. The bathrooms are extremely outdated with pink tile and are extremely small. There is a free continential breakfast but get there early and expect a HUGE crowd...an endless flow of people. Its not easy to do with young children. Better yet, bring the food back to your room. The pool is clean but a sad place - it overlooks the parking lot, and you can hear the freeway. Its not a "vacation destination" but more of a rest stop to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Montie56
Reviews.Content: This is a vey basic hotel. Pros: - Two room suites have bunk beds so it it nice for families - Free breakfast so you need to get there early - Laundry facilities (great if you are on a long trip) - Pool Cons: - Needs a good cleaning (there was an empty beer can in my room and hair in the shower). - Parking is tight - It's expensive during busy season (I paid $179-$199). - Elevator takes a long time - Lumpy mattress and scratchy sheets - Indifferent front desk staff

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: Ellorena
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with this hotel. When we walked in there was a terrible odor in the front lobby and the hallways. Front desk staff were just adequate, not friendly, very monotone. Hallway floors could use a good cleaning and the walls were filthy. The smell continued into our room. Lighting was poor. Room did not look like the pictures on the internet. When you sat on the bed, it made a sound like someone was flatuating. The bed was sagging and old. It gave me the creeps and I couldn't get thoughts of things living in the bed out of my head. It reminded me of those shows where they analyse the bacteria and other organisms in the beds of hotels. I called a few hotels to see if I could get a room somewhere else but the vacancy rate that week was very low and I didn't want to spend 300.00 per night for a hotel. There is no place to eat at the hotel and the steak house next door was way overpriced. I don't have anything nice to say about this hotel and I would never stay there again. The only reason we stayed is we booked through the internet and had paid for the 4 days. I'll never do that again either.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: JLIN
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice (suite like), the pool was fine, but parking and the neighborhood detract from the hotel. You have to drive everywhere as only one restaurant is within walking distance, and, well, I wouldn't want to walk from there at night anyway. It's a good value relative to the cost in terms of the hotel to recharge your batteries from a busy day, it's close to the freeways...but if you like to relax in a "resort" type environment spend some more $ elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: jade54
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here, and weren't happy with our stay at all. We were on a 10 day vacation, the first week was in Anaheim for Disney and other L.A attractions. Then drove to San Diego to visit Sea World and the Zoo. It is our own fault for not doing our research, and trusting our travel agent to do our booking. We arrived, and the outside of the hotel is extremely old and dumpy looking. The elevator was broken, and the whole lobby was a disaster and it smelled really BAD!!! Our room was old and run down. We have 3 children and had a room with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa. The pull out sofa was so lumpy and uncomfortable, the sheets had ripps and holes. I was so upset, because it had already been payed for, and we weren't sure what to do. We just stuck it out, we are really pretty easy going and don't like to complain, but I would like to save anyone else from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place - very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Minnie25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Rock N Roll Marathon. We had a Kids suite with bunk beds. We usually stay in Comforts, so we thought it was comparable. The portion of the room without the bunks got warm at night if you closed the door between the two sleeping areas. Parking was easy and free. One elevator was out of service the entire four nights we stayed there. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Access from the Interstate was excellent and very easy to get on and off. The Hunter Steakhouse next door had terrific food!! Our entire group had some very good filet mignons.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Comfort Inn San Diego 29 May to 31 May. Was a pleasant stay, my daughter loved the bunk beds in our room and the room was a nice size on the 2nd floor. The pool was nice, although we didn't have time to enjoy it. Did use the laundry facilities and those were fine. The staff was very pleasant and quickly responded to special requests. The beds were very comfortable and we experienced no noise issues. Was a good hotel and a reasonable price. The Steak House next door was very good also.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location, horrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Katherine2010
Reviews.Content: I did not enjoy my stay at this hotel. The worst problem was the location. Although not that far from major attractions (as cited in their own publicity) unless you have a car, it is highly inconvenient to get to them. It takes two buses and a train to get to downtown, through a very circuitous route given the need to get around the freeways, and because Hotel Circuit is split into two sections on either side of the freeway. Of course it is almost impossible to cross the freeway as there is liimited pedestrian access. Our room, along with many looked directly onto the freeway. The staff were friendly but uninformed and were not able to give us accurate directions to get anywhere, we bascially fended for oursleves, and got better directions from someone at the bus stop who only spoke Spanish. The hotel itself is tired, old and in need of major renovation or perhaps detonation. Our room was opposite the lift, so very noisy, and their were a number of vending machines including an ice machine which guests appeared to utilise all night. I never thought ice could be so noisy.... One of the lifts and one of the three washing machines were broken for the whole of our stay. While it appeared to be a budget hotel appealing to families, the price was not budget. We paid $170 AUD per night for the privilege of staying here. San Diego is not a cheap place to stay given the standard of accommodation we experienced for the price. I would NOT recommend staying at this hotel - pay a few bucks more and get something conveniently located and a lot newer.
